analyzed: publication country india  siddhilakṣmīdevyai namaḥ  śrī pādukābhyām namaḥ  dinakṛtya vidhi likhyate  tritatvena ācamya  varṇa ānatam vījam uddhṛtya atyādi argham namaḥ puṣpam namaḥ  hrā hrī hrū hre hrī hraḥ hrī saḥ śrī kulamārtaṇḍa mahābhairavāya
translated: Publication country: India

original: prakāsaśaktisahitāya namaḥ //🔽śkṣrī śrīmahāmārtaṇḍabhairavāya namaḥ //🔽ai hrī hsphre hsau //🔽akhaṇḍamaṇḍalākālaṃtyādi //🔽gururvrahmā gururviṣṇu gurudeva maheśvaraṃ //🔽gurudeva jagat sarvaṃ tasmai śrīguruve namaḥ //🔽ai paramagurubhyo namaḥ //🔽ai parameṣṭhīgurubhyo namaḥ //
analyzed: prakāsa śakti sahitāya namaḥ 🔽śkṣrī śrī mahā mārtaṇḍa bhairavāya namaḥ 🔽ai hrī hsphre hsau 🔽        🔽guruḥ vrahmā guruḥ viṣṇu guru deva maheśvaram 🔽guru deva jagat sarvam tasmai śrī guruve namaḥ 🔽ai parama gurubhyaḥ namaḥ 🔽ai parameṣṭhī gurubhyaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the one endowed with the power of illumination.🔽Salutations to the glorious Mahamartaṇḍabhairava.🔽Ai Hri Hṣphre Hsau.🔽From the unbroken mandala to the end.🔽The guru is Brahmā, the guru is Viṣṇu, the guru is the great god Maheśvara,🔽The guru is the entire world. Salutations to that glorious guru.🔽Ai Salutations to the supreme gurus.🔽Ai Salutations to the gurus of Parameṣṭhin.

analyzed: ai parama ācārya gurubhyaḥ namaḥ  vali sa padma āsanāya pādukām
translated: Salutations to the supreme teacher and guru.🔽To the lotus seat of Vala, I offer salutations.

analyzed: pavake kūrma āsanāya pādukām
translated: To the tortoise seat of Pavaka, I offer salutations.

analyzed: vikaraṇam
translated: The Vikarana.

original: ai khphre sakalaśatruprathamani anantaśaktidhāmne astrāya phaṭ pādukāṃ //
analyzed: ai khphre sakala śatru prathamani ananta śakti dhāmne astrāya phaṭ pādukām
translated: To the weapon that destroys all enemies, the abode of infinite power, I offer salutations with the Phad mantra.

analyzed: vajra mudrayā āmuvya veṣṭanam
translated: The binding with the Vajra Mudra.

original: p / ai khphre hū phaṭ vajrapañjare svāhā //
analyzed: p b ai     phaṭ vajrapañjare svāhā
translated: The Phad mantra of Vajra Panjara, svaha.

analyzed: daśa dvārasi arśanam
translated: The opening of the ten doors.

original: khphre calamakule kulamacale hrī hū phaṭ svāhā // / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / //
analyzed: khphre calamakule kulamacale hrī hū phaṭ svāhā
translated: The mantra of the moving and unmoving, the Kula in the immovable, Hri Hu Phat Svaha.

original: khphre sakalaśatru pramathani anantaśaktidhāmne astrāya phaṭ //
analyzed: khphre sakala śatru pramathani ananta śakti dhāmne astrāya phaṭ
translated: To the weapon that destroys all enemies, the abode of infinite power, I offer salutations with the Phad mantra.

analyzed: kara śodhanam
translated: The purification of the hands.

original: khphre paramahaṃsini sarvajñātā śaktidhāmne aṃguṣṭhābhyāṃ namaḥ //
analyzed: khphre paramahaṃsini sarvajñātā śakti dhāmne aṃguṣṭhābhyām namaḥ
translated: The mantra of the supreme swan, the abode of the power of omniscience, I offer salutations with the thumbs.

analyzed: nirvāṇa mārga de tṛpti śakti dhāmne tarjanībhyām namaḥ
translated: The mantra of the giver of the path to nirvana, the abode of the power of satisfaction, I offer salutations with the index fingers.

original: khphre viṣamopaplavapraśamani anādivodhaśaktidhāmne madhyamābhyāṃ🔽namaḥ //🔽khphre sakaladuritāriṣṭakleśadalani svatantraśaktidhāmne anāmikābhyāṃ
analyzed: viṣama upaplava praśamani anādi vodha śakti dhāmne madhyamābhyām  namaḥ  sakala durita ariṣṭa kleśa dalani svatantra śakti dhāmne anāmikābhyām
translated: The mantra of the pacifier of the calamities of adversity, the abode of the power of beginningless enlightenment, I offer salutations with the middle fingers.

analyzed: namaḥ
translated: The mantra of the destroyer of all sins, misfortunes, and afflictions, the abode of independent power, I offer salutations with the ring fingers.

original: khphre sarvāpadāmbhodhitaraṇi aluptaśaktidhāmne kaniṣṭhābhyāṃ namaḥ //🔽khphre sakaraśatrupramathani anantaśaktidhāmne astrāya karatalapṛṣṭhābhyāṃ
analyzed: sarva āpad ambhodhi taraṇi alupta śakti dhāmne kaniṣṭhābhyām namaḥ  khphre sakara śatru pramathani ananta śakti dhāmne astrāya kara tala pṛṣṭhābhyām
translated: KHFRE to the remover of the ocean of all calamities, to the abode of unfailing power, I offer salutations to the two smallest fingers.

analyzed: namaḥ
translated: KHFRE to the destroyer of enemies along with their allies, to the abode of infinite power, to the weapon, I offer salutations to the back of the palm and the wrist.

analyzed: vāram nyāsaḥ  namaḥ sarva siddhiyoginībhyaḥ pūrva vaktra nātha pādukām
translated: The nyasa (assignment) is done again.🔽KHFRE salutations to all the accomplished yoginis, to the sandals of the lord of the eastern face.

analyzed: namaḥ sarva siddhi mātṛbhyaḥ dakṣiṇa vaktra nātha pādukām
translated: KHFRE salutations to all the mothers of accomplishment, to the sandals of the lord of the southern face.

original: khphre namo nityoditānandananditāyai uttaravaktranāthapādukāṃ //🔽p / khphre sakalakulacakranāyikāyai paścimavaktranāthapādukāṃ //
analyzed: namaḥ nityodita ānanda nanditāyai uttara vaktra nātha pādukām  a khphre sakala kula cakra nāyikāyai paścima vaktra nātha pādukām
translated: KHFRE salutations to the one who is always delighted with eternal bliss, to the sandals of the lord of the northern face.🔽KHFRE to the leader of the entire Kula circle, to the sandals of the lord of the western face.

analyzed: bhagavatyai caṇḍakāpālinyai ūrddha vaktra nātha pādukām
translated: KHFRE to the revered Chandika, to the sandals of the lord of the upward-facing face.

original: khphre paramahaṃsini sarvajñātāśaktidhāmne hṛdayāya namaḥ //🔽khphre nirvānamārgade tṛptiśaktidhāmne śirase svāhā //
analyzed: khphre paramahaṃsini sarvajñātā śakti dhāmne hṛdayāya namaḥ  khphre nirvāna mārga de tṛpti śakti dhāmne śirase svāhā
translated: KHFRE to the supreme swan, to the abode of the power of omniscience, salutations to the heart.🔽KHFRE to the giver of the path to nirvana, to the abode of the power of satisfaction, salutations to the head.

analyzed: khphre viṣama upaplavva praśamani anādi vodha śakti dhāmne śikhyāyai vaṣaṭ
translated: KHFRE to the pacifier of the calamities of adversity, to the abode of the power of beginningless knowledge, salutations to the tuft.

original: khphre sakaladuritāriṣṭakleśadalani svatantraśaktidhāmne kavacāya hū //🔽khphre sarvāpadāmbhodhitariṇi aluptaśaktidhāmne netratrayāya vauṣaṭ //
analyzed: khphre sakala durita ariṣṭa kleśa dalani svatantra śakti dhāmne kavacāya hū  khphre sarva āpad ambhodhi tariṇi alupta śakti dhāmne netratrayāya vauṣaṭ
translated: KHFRE, to the armor that destroys all sins, misfortunes and afflictions, the abode of independent power, HŪM.🔽KHFRE, to the three eyes that save from all calamities and oceans, the abode of unfailing power, VAUṢAṬ.

analyzed: khphre sakala śatru pramathani ananta śakti dhāmne astrāya phaṭ
translated: KHFRE, to the weapon that destroys all enemies, the abode of infinite power, PHAṬ.

analyzed: kubhyaṃtaṃtyāsaḥ
translated: The final letters of the vowels.

original: ta bhrūmadhye // hya hṛdi // thā nābhau // o mukhe // hrī vāmanāśāpuṭe //
analyzed: ta bhrū madhye hya hṛdi thā nābhau o mukhe hrī vāmanāśāpuṭe
translated: Tha in the forehead, Ha in the heart, Tha in the navel, O in the mouth, HRĪM in the left nostril,

original: hū dakṣanāśāpuṭe // hā vāmanetre // kṣā vāmakarṇe // kro dakṣakarṇe //
analyzed: hū dakṣa nāśā puṭe hā vāma netre kṣā vāma karṇe kro dakṣa karṇe
translated: HŪM in the right nostril, HA in the left eye, KṢĀ in the left ear, KRO in the right ear,

analyzed: na liṃge maḥ guḍe
translated: Na in the genitals, and MAḤ in the anus.

original: iti tadvāraṃ nyāsaḥ / // / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / pujā //🔽khphre hrī śrī jalapātrāsanāya pādukāṃ //
analyzed: iti tad vāram nyāsaḥ    pujā  khphre hrī śrī jala pātra āsanāya pādukām
translated: Thus the nyāsa of the respective parts. The worship.🔽KHFRE, to the seat of the water vessel, the sandals.

original: p / khphre hrī śrī hskṣmlvryū jalapātrabhaṭṭārikāya pādukāṃ //
analyzed: pādukām
translated: KHFRE, to the revered water vessel, the sandals.

analyzed: khphre hṛdayāya ityādi
translated: KHFRE, to the heart, and so on.

analyzed: āvāhānā dhenumudrām gāyatrī
translated: The invocation, etc., the dhēnumudrā, the Gāyatrī.

original: khphre siddhilakṣmyai vidmahe navatyadhika dhīmahi tan no lakṣmīḥ pracodayāt //
analyzed: siddhi lakṣmyai vidmahe navati adhika dhīmahi tat naḥ lakṣmīḥ pracodayāt
translated: KHFRE, we meditate on the Goddess of Accomplishment, the intelligent one, may that Goddess of Fortune inspire us.

analyzed: abhiṣiñcanam
translated: The consecration.

analyzed: arghapātra pūjā  khphre hrī śrī arghapātra āsanāya pādukām
translated: Worship of the Arghya Vessel.🔽Kshhphrem Hreem Shrim Pādū to the seat of the Arghya Vessel.

original: khphre hrī śrī śkṣmlvryū ānandabhairavāyai vauṣaṭ //
analyzed: khphre hrī śrī ānandabhairavāyai vauṣaṭ
translated: Kshhphrem Hreem Shrim Vaushat to Ānanda Bhairava.

original: khphre hrī śrī śvāṃ saḥ saḥ saḥ saḥ saḥ parādevī amṛtaṃ vama svāhā //
analyzed: khphre hrī śrī śvāṃ saḥ saḥ saḥ saḥ saḥ parā devī amṛtam vama svāhā
translated: Kshhphrem Hreem Shrim Svāhā to the nectar-vomiting Supreme Goddess.

analyzed: dravya śodhanam
translated: Purification of the substances. Three Ānjalis.

original: o hrī hū hā phre kṣā kro namaḥ // //
analyzed: o hrī hū hā phre kṣā kro namaḥ
translated: Om Hreem Hūm Hā Phrem Kshā Kroh Namah.

analyzed: khphre hṛdayāya ityādi
translated: Kshhphrem to the heart etc.

analyzed: āvāhana ādi
translated: Invocation etc.

analyzed: yonimudrām
translated: Yoni Mudrā.

analyzed: kacchapa mudrayā
translated: Kacchapa Mudrā.

analyzed: bhūtaśuddhi
translated: Bhūta Śuddhi.

original: ai hrī śrī hsphre hsau hsau hsphre śrī hrī ai //
analyzed: ai hrī śrī hsphre hsau hsau hsphre śrī hrī ai
translated: Ai Hreem Shrim Hsphrem Hsaum Hsaum Hsphrem Shrim Hreem Ai.

analyzed: pātra pūjā
translated: Worship of the Vessel.

analyzed: ātmane candanam pādukām akṣatam
translated: Kshhphrem Pādū to oneself and sandal. Akshata.

analyzed: vīra bhasma
translated: Vīrabhasma.

analyzed: sarva jana mohinī pādukām
translated: Kshhphrem Pādū to the deluder of all people.

original: o hrī hū hā phre kṣā kro namaḥ ātmane puṣpaṃ pādukāṃ //
analyzed: o hrī hū hā phre kṣā kro namaḥ ātmane puṣpam pādukām
translated: Om Hreem Hūm Hā Phrem Kshā Kroh Namah Pādū to oneself and flowers.

analyzed: khphre sakala śatru pramathani astrāya phaṭ
translated: Kshhphrem to the weapon that destroys all enemies. Phat.

analyzed: a anena mantreṇa atma śirasi siñcayet  /
translated: With this mantra, one should sprinkle on one's head.

analyzed: ātma pūjā
translated: The worship of oneself with the Śveta mantra.

analyzed: atha kṣetrapracalī paṭhet
translated: Then one should recite the Kṣetra Pracalī.

analyzed: o namaḥ siddhi mahā kālī kālikāyai
translated: Om, salutations to the Siddhi Mahākālī, the destroyer of time.

original: trailokyai namaste tribhuvananamite kālike viśvacaṇḍe vāme vāmāntarasthe
analyzed: trailokyai namaḥ te tribhuvana namite kālike viśva caṇḍe vāme vāma antara sthe
translated: Salutations to you, the three worlds, bowed to by the three worlds, Kālikā, the fierce one of the universe, on the left, residing in the left corner,

analyzed: tridaśa vara nute naumi te
translated: I bow to your pair of feet, praised by the best of the thirty gods.

original: hrasvadīrghe viśarge akacaṭatapayaśe kṣaḥ prakāśāntarasthe muṇḍe hū
analyzed: hrasva dīrghe viśarge a ka ca ṭa ta pa ya śe kṣaḥ prakāśa antara sthe muṇḍe hū
translated: Short and long, in the release, with the sounds ka, ca, ṭa, ta, pa, and ya, shining in the middle, with a shaved head, with the sound huṃ,

analyzed: viśva rūpe nati para vara de śeṣa nāga uttarīye
translated: O you of the form of the universe, I bow to you, O best of bestowers of boons, with the serpent Śeṣa as your upper garment.

original: candrārkau karṇe pūrau tarataratarale trāṃhi māṃ koṭarākṣi jyeṣṭhe vāme
analyzed: candra arkau karṇe pūrau taratara tarale trāṃhi mām koṭara akṣi jyeṣṭhe vāme
translated: With the moon and sun as your earrings, very restless, O you with hollow eyes, save me, O Jyeṣṭhā, on the left,

analyzed: tha raudre jvalita śikhi śikhe mātri nande su nande
translated: O terrible one, with the flames of the sacrificial fire, O mother, O Nandā, O Sunandā.

original: hāhākāre viriñci pranatajanahite vyādhisaṃdehanāśe kaṃkāle kālakāle
analyzed: hāhākāre viriñci pranata jana hite vyādhi saṃdeha nāśe kaṃkāle kāla kāle
translated: With the sound of Hā Hā, Brahmā, for the benefit of those who bow down, destroying doubts about disease, with a skeleton, in the black and white (parts of the eye),

analyzed: kali karuṣa hare sadya vāma ādya ghore
translated: O remover of the Kali age, the anger of the Sadya and Vāmā (mantras), O Aghorā.

original: huṃ vakre ṣusvarūpe mama varanirate kandacakrodarasthe vyomahṛdvyomavāhe🔽haraharaviṣame sphoṭaya pretavāhe /
analyzed: hum vakre ṣu svarūpe mama vara nirate kanda cakra udara sthe vyoma hṛd vyomavāhe  harahara viṣame sphoṭaya preta vāhe
translated: O Huṃ, O Vakrā, of the form of Ṣu, O you who are intent on giving me boons, residing in the lotus and cakra,🔽O you who carry the wind of the sky in the sky of the heart, O you who are uneven like Hara and Hara, O you who carry the wind of the dead, burst forth.

original: jaṃbhe mohe gnijihve śaśaśaśaśavare kolagiryādhivāse vicce viśveśvarīye
analyzed: jaṃbhe mohe gnijihve śaśaśaśavare kolagiryādhivāse vicce viśveśvarīye
translated: O Jhambhā, O Mohā, O Agnijihvā, O you who are supreme like the moon, O you who reside on the Kolagiri mountain, O Vici, O you who are the mistress of the universe,

analyzed: matha matha mathane duḥkṛta ghnāni devi
translated: O you who crush, crush, crush, O you who destroy evil deeds, O goddess.

original: p / drāṃ drāṃ drāṃ drāṃ drāviṇīye kilikilirabhase carmamuṇḍe prahāre
analyzed: drāṃ drāṃ drāṃ drāṃ drāviṇīye kili kili rabhase carma muṇḍe prahāre
translated: Draam draam draam draam to the one who melts, in the dance of kila kila, in the skull-garland, in the blow,

original: klī plu ra tatvavāhe kilikilisubhage mantravidyāvagāhe /
analyzed: klī plu ra ta tva vāhe kili kili subhage mantra vidyā avagāhe
translated: Klim plum rat to the one who carries the essence, in the auspicious kila kila, in the immersion in mantra and knowledge,

original: preṃ preṃ preṃ pretavāhe kalakalakalahe pāśakaṭṭārikāgre divyadivyādhivāse
analyzed: preṃ preṃ preṃ pretavāhe kalakala kalahe pāśa kaṭṭārikā agre divya divya adhivāse
translated: Preem preem preem to the one who carries the departed, in the clamorous quarrel, in the forefront of the noose and axe, in the divine divine abode,

analyzed: khakhakhakhakhakhagame ghargharārāvaghore  /
translated: Khakhakhakhakha to the one who moves in the sky, in the terrible roar of gharghara,

original: kṣīṃ phaṭ hūṃ phaṭ svarūpe ḍaḍaḍaḍaḍamare hūṃ jayatyādhivāse🔽vicchiṃdhyāstrena vāme ṭhaṭhaṭhaṭhaṭhaṭhamare kṣe kṣakāre subhīme /
analyzed: kṣīṃ phaṭ   phaṭ svarūpe ḍaḍa ḍaḍa ḍamare hūm jayati ādhivāse  vicchindhya astrena vāme ṭha ṭha ṭha ṭha ṭha mare kṣe kṣakāre su bhīme
translated: Ksheem phat hum phat to the one of true form, in the damara of dadadadada, hum to the one who conquers in the abode,🔽In the weapon of vichchhinna, in the left, in the damara of tha tha tha tha tha tha, in the terrible letter kshe,

original: tvāṃ vande koṭarākṣiṃ varavaradaśane dakṣakārākṣarīye he he
analyzed: tvām vande koṭara akṣim vara vara daśane dakṣa kārākṣarīye he he
translated: I praise you, O you with hollow eyes, O you with the fangs that grant boons, O you with the syllables of the right action, O you with the sound of hum,

original: hūṃkārarāve paca paca dahane muṃca muṃca pramarte // //
analyzed: hūṃkāra rāve paca paca dahane muṃca muṃca pramarte
translated: In the burning of pach pach, in the burning of munch munch, in the destruction,

analyzed: madhumada rabhase jvālinī jvālitābhyaḥ
translated: In the dance of honey and wine, in the blazing and ignited ones,

original: caṇḍe ekāgrarūpe ghurighuritaghurāghorarūpe bhaghna phaṭ phaṭ
analyzed: caṇḍe ekāgra rūpe ghuri ghurita ghurā ghora rūpe bhaghna phaṭ phaṭ
translated: In the fierce one, in the form of single-pointedness, in the terrible sound of ghur ghur, in the form of ghora, in the breaking of phat phat,

analyzed: phreṃkāra rūpe kahakaharamaṇi preta bhasma upalipte
translated: In the form of the sound of preem, in the necklace of kahakaha, in the one smeared with the ashes of the departed,

original: p / mārikroṃkārarūpe kahakaharasane kṛṣṇakaṃkālavīṇe kṣāṃ kṣāṃ
analyzed: māri kroṃkāra rūpe kahakaha rasane kṛṣṇa kaṃkāla vīṇe kṣāṃ kṣāṃ
translated: In the form of the sound of marikroom, in the necklace of kahakaha, in the one with the black skeleton and lute, in the kshaam kshaam,

analyzed: kṣāṃ krodha rūpe haha ha ha ravye naumi caṇḍa asi dhāre
translated: Ksha, in the form of anger, with the sound of ha ha ha ha, I bow to the one with the sharp sword-like stream,

original: tvāṃ vande sarvakālaṃ narapiśitamukhī sācaritrādhivāse he he hūṃkāranāde
analyzed: tvām vande sarvakālam nara piśita mukhī sa ācaritra adhivāse he he hūṃkāra nāde
translated: I praise you at all times, with a face of human flesh, dwelling in the abode of your own conduct, with the sound of he he and hum,

analyzed: lalalalalalane cheda pheṭkāra rūpe  /
translated: With the sound of lalalala, cutting off, with the form of phet,

original: ḍāṃ ḍāṃ ḍāṃ ḍāmarīye vara vara varade ghorahūṃkāravege
analyzed: ḍām ḍām ḍām ḍāmarīye vara vara vara de ghora hūṃkāra vege
translated: Dam dam dam, to Damari, grant, grant, grant, with the speed of the terrible sound of hum,

analyzed: nāraiḥ nāra anta dāme yaja yaja pada eke koṭikarṇa adhivāse
translated: With the garland of human heads, worship, worship, in the abode of the one with a million ears,

original: yo vīro vīravaṃdye ṛṣigananiyato yogapīṭhopapīṭhe bhutvā tvaṃ tasya nityaṃ
analyzed: yaḥ vīraḥ vīra vaṃdye yoga pīṭha upapīṭhe tvam tasya nityam
translated: The hero who is praised by the heroes, determined by the group of sages, in the seat of yoga and the subsidiary seats, having become you, always

analyzed: vitara vara śubhe kāmarūpa avatīrṇam
translated: Grant the boon of auspiciousness, descended in the form of desire,

original: nāmnā kṣetrāvalīyaṃ paṭhati śubhayaśaḥ mantrasiṃhaṃ praṇītā
analyzed: nāmnā kṣetrāvalī iyam paṭhati śubha yaśaḥ mantrasiṃham praṇītā
translated: The one who recites the name Kshetravali, of auspicious fame, the lion of mantras, well-composed,

original: divyādivyādivighnā prabhavamiha bhave naiva devi prabhāvā //
analyzed: divya a divya a di vighnā prabhavam iha bhave nā eva devi prabhāvā
translated: By the power of this, O Goddess, may all the divine and non-divine obstacles not arise here.

original: iti śrī siddhilakṣmīmate sakāśe jayadrathe vidyāpīthe pratyaṃgiryā
analyzed: iti śrī siddhilakṣmīmate sakāśe jayadrathe vidyā pīthe pratyaṃgiryā
translated: Thus, in the presence of Shri Siddhi Lakshmi Mata, in the Vidya Peetha of Jayadratha, by Pratyangira,

analyzed: kṣetra āvali pīṭha samāptam
translated: The Kshetravali Peetha... is complete.

analyzed: pañca vali viyaḥ  mayūrāsanāya pādukām
translated: The five Valis...🔽The sandals to the peacock seat.

analyzed: śrī hrī kula putra vaṭuka nāthāya pādukām
translated: The sandals to Shri Hri, the son of the Kula, Lord of the Vatsas.

analyzed: śvanam vali
translated: To the dog, oblation.

analyzed: narāsanāya pādukām
translated: To the seat of men, I offer sandals.

original: thskrau prastaradīpadaṃbhakī devī mahādhvāṃkṣa kṣetrapālāya pādukāṃ
analyzed: prastara dīpa daṃbhakī devī mahā dhvāṃkṣa kṣetrapālāya pādukām
translated: To the goddess of the lamp of the sacred thread, to the great owl, to the guardian of the field, I offer sandals.

analyzed: śvanam vali  siṃhāsanāya pādukām
translated: To the dog, oblation.🔽To the lion seat, I offer sandals.

analyzed: yā yoginībhyaḥ pādukām
translated: To the yoginis, I offer sandals. Oblation.

original: ye keścit yoginīṇāṃ pīṭhajā kṣetrajā sahajā yogajā garbhajā kulajā
analyzed: ye keścid yoginīṇām pīṭha jā kṣetra jā sahajā yoga jā garbha jā kula jā
translated: Whatever yoginis are born from the seat, from the field, from the womb, from yoga, from the womb, from the family,

original: saṃdohajā ye keścid yogiṇīṇāṃ kṣecarī bhūcarī gocarī ekākṣarī dvyakṣarī🔽tryakṣarī catuṣpañcaṣaṭsaptākṣarīṇāṃ bhṛjagāminīnāṃ yathopapannānāṃ
analyzed: saṃdoha jāḥ ye keścid yogiṇīṇām kṣecarī bhūcarī gocarī ekākṣarī dvi akṣarī  tri akṣarī catuṣpañca ṣaṣ sapta akṣarīṇām bhṛja gāminīnām yathā upapannānām
translated: from the group, whatever yoginis are moving in the sky, on the earth, in the cow, with one syllable, two syllables,

original: valiṃ gṛhna mama siddhiṃ kurvantu hūṃ phaṭ svāhā //
analyzed: valim gṛhna mama siddhim kurvantu   phaṭ svāhā
translated: three syllables, four, five, six, seven syllables, I offer oblation. Accept the oblation and grant me accomplishment. Hrum phat svāhā.

analyzed: preta āsanāya pādukām
translated: To the seat of the ghost, I offer sandals.

analyzed: śrī siddhicāmuṇḍā īśvarā pādukām
translated: To the goddess of accomplishment and Chamundeshvari, I offer sandals. To the dog, oblation.

analyzed: pādukām
translated: To the mouse seat, I offer sandals.

original: gā gī gū gaḥ glau śrīkulagaṇeśvarāya pādukāṃ // śvanaṃ vali //
analyzed: gā gī gū gaḥ glau śrī kula gaṇa īśvarāya pādukām
translated: To the lord of the Kula Gaṇeśvara, I offer sandals. To the dog, oblation.

analyzed: āvāhana ādi daṇḍa tarjanī yoni vindu gajamudrām japa
translated: Invocation etc., staff, index finger, yoni, bindu, elephant mudrā. Japa.

original: śrī hrī svāhā // thro svāhā // yā svāhā // hskhphre svāhā // glau svāhā //
analyzed: śrī hrī svāhā thro svāhā yā svāhā hskhphre svāhā glau svāhā
translated: Śrī, Hrī, Svāhā. Thre, Svāhā. Yā, Svāhā. Hskhphre, Svāhā. Glou, Svāhā.

analyzed: idam japam gṛhāna svāhā
translated: This Japa, to the houses, Svāhā.

analyzed: p a stotra
translated: The Hymn.

original: gauryāputraṃ kumāraṃ gagaṇatanudhṛtaṃ kṣetrakaṃ yoginīṃ ca cāmuṇḍā
analyzed: gauryāputram kumāram gagaṇa tanu dhṛtam kṣetrakam yoginīm ca cāmuṇḍā
translated: The son of Gaurī, Kumāra, the yogi of the sky-like body, the field, and the Yoginī, and Cāmuṇḍā,

analyzed: caṇḍa rūpāḥ durita bhaya haram vighnanātham gaṇeśam
translated: The form of Caṇḍa, the remover of the fear of sin, Gaṇeśa, the lord of obstacles,

analyzed: puṣpa ādyā dhūpa dīpa āmiṣa madhū valibhiḥ carcitā bhūṣita aṅgī cakre
translated: Adorned with offerings of flowers and so on, incense, lamps, meat, honey, and garlands, the body adorned,

analyzed: bhukti mukti pradātā
translated: Having worshipped, may the giver of desired fruits, the giver of worldly enjoyment and liberation,

analyzed: sarvam paripūrṇam astu āvāhana
translated: May everything be complete in the method of worship with the five-fold garland. Invocation.

original: khphre hrī śrī yā sā parāparā devī khaḍgasthā khagarūpiṇī //
translated: Khphre Hrī Śrī, that supreme and inferior goddess, dwelling on the sword, in the form of a sword,

analyzed: sura loka gatāyānti āyāntu iha maṇḍale
translated: Having gone to the world of the gods, may they come to this maṇḍala.🔽I shall invoke, I invite.

analyzed: idam āvāhiṣye āvāhayāmi hataḥ tri deva pūjā
translated: The invocation is accomplished. Tri-deity worship.

analyzed: narāsanāya pādukām  mayūrāsanāya pādukām
translated: Khphre, to the human seat, the sandals.🔽Khphre, to the peacock seat, the sandals.

analyzed: pādukām
translated: Khphre, to the mouse seat, the sandals.

original: khphre thhsrau prastaradvīpadambhakī devī mahādhvāṃ kṣetrapālāya
analyzed: khphre thhsrau prastaradvīpadambhakī devī mahādhvām kṣetrapālāya
translated: KSHPHREM THSMSRAUM Prastaradvipa Dambaki Devi Mahaadhwam Kshetrapala

original: pādukāṃ // vali //🔽khphre śrī hrī kulaputravaṭukanāthāya pādukāṃ // vali //
analyzed: pādukām  śrī hrī kula putra vaṭuka nāthāya pādukām
translated: Paduka. Vali.🔽KSHPHREM Shri Hri Kulputra Vatukanatha Paduka. Vali.

original: khphre gā gī gū gaḥ glau śrīkulagaṇeśvarāya pādukāṃ // vali //
analyzed: gā gī gū gaḥ glau śrī kula gaṇa īśvarāya pādukām
translated: KSHPHREM GA GEE GUM GAH GLUM Shri Kul Ganeswara Paduka. Vali.

analyzed: āvāhana ādi

analyzed: tarjanī daṇḍa gajamudrām
translated: Tarjani Danda Gajamudra.

original: p / pūrvadvāra pūjanaṃ // o hrā śānti toraṇāya namaḥ //
analyzed: p b pūrvadvāra pūjana o hrā śānti toraṇāya namaḥ

analyzed: o hrā kṛta yugāya namaḥ śūle
translated: OM HRAUM Salutations to the Krita Yuga. On the trident.

original: o hrā pūṣṇe namaḥ // o hrā dhātre namaḥ //

analyzed: o vidhātre namaḥ tatas śākhayoḥ

original: o hrā prāśāntāya namaḥ // o hrā śiśirāya namaḥ //
analyzed: o hrā prāśāntāya namaḥ o hrā śiśirāya namaḥ

original: o hrā bhūrlokāya namaḥ // o hrā bhuvalokāya namaḥ //
analyzed: o hrā bhūrlokāya namaḥ o hrā bhuvarlokāya namaḥ
translated: OM HRAUM Salutations to the Bhuloka. OM HRAUM Salutations to the Bhuvarloka.

analyzed: o hrā somāya namaḥ o hrā aṃgārāya namaḥ

analyzed: o hrā avargaḥ vrahmāṇyai namaḥ

analyzed: o hrā kavargaḥ māheśvaryai namaḥ

original: o hrā pratyuṣāya namaḥ // o hrā prabhāsāya namaḥ //
analyzed: o hrā pratyuṣāya namaḥ o hrā prabhāsāya namaḥ

analyzed: o hrā śānti kalā dvārāya namaḥ   o hrāḥ īśvara adhidevatāyai namaḥ
translated: O HRAUM! Salutations to the door of the principle of peace. O HRAUM! Salutations to the presiding deity of Ishvara.

original: urdvodumvarike // o hrā gaṇapataye namaḥ // o hrā sarasvatyai namaḥ //
analyzed: o hrā gaṇapataye namaḥ o hrā sarasvatyai namaḥ
translated: O HRAUM! Salutations to Ganapati. O HRAUM! Salutations to Sarasvati.

original: o hrā mahālakṣmyai namaḥ // tataḥ śāya / // o hrā nandine namaḥ //
analyzed: o hrā mahālakṣmyai namaḥ tatas śāya  o hrā nandine namaḥ
translated: O HRAUM! Salutations to Mahakali. O HRAUM! Salutations to Nandi.

original: o hrā mahākālāya namaḥ // o hrā gaṃgāyai namaḥ //
analyzed: o hrā mahākālāya namaḥ o hrā gaṃgāyai namaḥ
translated: O HRAUM! Salutations to Mahakal. O HRAUM! Salutations to Ganga.

analyzed: o hrā yamunāyai namaḥ dhvajā
translated: O HRAUM! Salutations to Yamuna. O HRAUM! Salutations to the flag.🔽O HRAUM! Salutations to the sword. O HRAUM! Salutations to the spear. O HRAUM! Salutations to the arrow.🔽O HRAUM! Salutations to the bow. O HRAUM! Salutations to the conch. O HRAUM! Salutations to the discus.

original: o hrā lū vajrāya phaṇ namaḥ // patākā //
analyzed: o hrā lū vajrāya phaṭ namaḥ patākā
translated: O HRAUM! Salutations to the mace. O HRAUM! Salutations to the lotus. O HRAUM! Salutations to the bell.🔽O HRAUM! Salutations to the trident. O HRAUM! Salutations to the staff. O HRAUM! Salutations to the axe.🔽O HRAUM! Salutations to the plough. O HRAUM! Salutations to the pestle. O HRAUM! Salutations to the wheel.🔽O HRAUM! Salutations to the thunderbolt. O HRAUM! Salutations to the banner.

analyzed: o hrā kumudāyai namaḥ
translated: O HRAUM! Salutations to Kumuda.

original: p / o hrā indrāya gajāsanāya namaḥ // kalasadhyānaṃ //
analyzed: p a o hrāḥ indrāya gajāsanāya namaḥ kalasa dhyānam
translated: O HRAUM! Salutations to Indra seated on an elephant.

analyzed: airāvata samārūḍham vajrahastam su śobhanam
translated: Aided by Airavata, with a thunderbolt in hand, very beautiful,

analyzed: pīta aruṇa nibham deham āhvayāmi sacīpatim
translated: with a body resembling yellow and red, I invoke the lord of Sachi.

original: o hrā lu indrāya namaḥ // vali //
analyzed: o hrā lu indrāya namaḥ vali
translated: O HRAUM! Salutations to Indra.

original: o hrā prayāgahetvaśitāṅgebhyaḥ valiṃ gṛhna svāhā //
analyzed: o hrā prayāga hetu aśita aṅgebhyaḥ valim gṛhna svāhā
translated: O HRAUM! Salutations to the powerful ones born from the waters of Prayaga. Accept the oblation.

analyzed: dhūpa ādi stuti antam
translated: Incense and other offerings up to the praise.

analyzed: namaḥ astu te sacīnātha pūrva ādi patiḥ īśvara
translated: Salutations to you, O lord of Sachi, the eastern lord, the powerful one,

original: yajñayāgeṣu karmāṇi rakṣārthaṃ sannidhī bhava // atra gandhādi // cchāgai / //
analyzed: yajña yāgeṣu karmāṇi rakṣā artham sannidhī bhava atra gandha ādi
translated: In the sacrificial rituals, be present for the sake of protection. Here, with scents etc.

original: oṃ riddhitoraṇāya namaḥ // oṃ hrā riddhidvārāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om riddhitoraṇāya namaḥ om hrā riddhidvārāya namaḥ
translated: Om, salutations to the prosperous archway. Om, Hrām, salutations to the prosperous door.

original: khadiravṛkṣāya namaḥ // oṃ hrā agnayecchāgāsanāya namaḥ //
analyzed: khadira vṛkṣāya namaḥ om hrāḥ agnaye chāga āsanāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the Khadira tree. Om, Hrām, salutations to Agni seated on the goat.

analyzed: kalasa dhyānam
translated: Contemplation of the water pot.

analyzed: chāga pṛṭha āsanam devam śakti hastam mahā valam
translated: The god seated on a goat's back, with a Shakti in his hand, of great strength,

analyzed: rakta varṇa su teja aṅgam vaiśvānaram namāmi aham
translated: with limbs radiant with red color, I bow to the Vaishvanara fire.

original: oṃ hrā ru agnaye namaḥ // dhvajā //🔽oṃ hrā rū śaktaye phaṇnamaḥ // patākā //
analyzed: om hrā ru agnaye namaḥ dhvajā  om hrā rū śaktaye phaṭ namaḥ patākā
translated: Om, Hrām, Rau, salutations to Agni. The flag.🔽Om, Hrām, Rū, salutations to Shakti. The banner.

analyzed: om kumudākṣāyai namaḥ valim
translated: Om, salutations to Kumudaksha. The offering.

original: oṃ hrā varuṇatripurāntakarurubhyaḥ valiṃ gṛhna svāhā // dhūpādistutyantaṃ //
analyzed: om   varuṇa tripurāntaka rurubhyaḥ valim gṛhna svāhā dhūpa ādi stuti antam
translated: Om, Hrām, to Varuna, Tripura, and Rudra, accept the offering, Svāhā. Incense etc. up to praise.

analyzed: namaḥ astu te sapta ṛciṣe āgneya adhipati īśvara
translated: Salutations to you, the one with seven flames, the lord of the southeast.

analyzed: yajñam pālayatena eva rakṣā artham sannidhī bhava
translated: By this alone, protect the sacrifice. Be present for the sake of protection.

analyzed: atra gandha ādi dakṣiṇa dvāra
translated: Here, with scents etc. The southern door.

original: oṃ hrā bhūtitoraṇāya namaḥ // oṃ siddheśvarāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrāḥ bhūtitoraṇāya namaḥ om siddheśvarāya namaḥ
translated: Om, salutations to the prosperous archway. Om, salutations to Siddheśvara.

original: oṃ hrā yajurvedāya namaḥ // oṃ hrā tretāyugāya namaḥ // śūle / //
analyzed: om hrā yajurvedāya namaḥ om hrā tretā yugāya namaḥ śūle
translated: Om Hram Yajur Veda, salutations. Om Hram Treta Yuga, salutations. In the trident.

original: oṃ hrā ugrāya namaḥ // oṃ hrā indave namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrāḥ ugrāya namaḥ om hrāḥ indave namaḥ
translated: Om Hram to the fierce one, salutations. Om Hram to the moon, salutations.

analyzed: om hrāḥ aryamne namaḥ śākhā
translated: Om Hram to Aryaman, salutations. In the branch.

original: oṃ hrā pradyumnāya namaḥ // oṃ hrā aśvakāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrā pradyumnāya namaḥ om hrā aśvakāya namaḥ
translated: Om Hram to Pradyumna, salutations. Om Hram to the horse, salutations.

original: oṃ hrā svarlokāya namaḥ // oṃ hrā maharlokāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrā svarlokāya namaḥ om hrā mahar lokāya namaḥ
translated: Om Hram to the heavenly world, salutations. Om Hram to the Maharloka, salutations.

original: oṃ hrā vudhāya namaḥ // oṃ hrā vṛhaspataye namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrā vudhāya namaḥ om hrā vṛhaspataye namaḥ
translated: Om Hram to Mercury, salutations. Om Hram to Brihaspati, salutations.

original: oṃ hrā cavarge kaumāryai namaḥ // oṃ hrā ajaghanyāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrā cavarge kaumāryai namaḥ om hrā ajaghanyāya namaḥ
translated: Om Hram to Kumari in the Chavarga, salutations. Om Hram to the non-lowest, salutations.

analyzed: om hrā jaghanyāya namaḥ dvāre
translated: Om Hram to the lowest, salutations. In the door.

analyzed: om hrāḥ vidyākalā dvārāya namaḥ
translated: Om Hram to the door of the Vidyakala, salutations.

analyzed: om hrāḥ rudrāya adhidevatāyai namaḥ
translated: Om Hram to Rudra, the presiding deity, salutations. In the upper girdle.

original: oṃ hrā gaṇapataye namaḥ // oṃ hrā sarasvatyai namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrā gaṇapataye namaḥ om hrā sarasvatyai namaḥ
translated: Om Hram to Ganapati, salutations. Om Hram to Sarasvati, salutations.

original: oṃ hrā mahālakṣmyai namaḥ // oṃ hrā bhṛṃgire namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrā mahālakṣmyai namaḥ om hrā bhṛṃgire namaḥ
translated: Om Hram to Mahaha Lakshmi, salutations. Om Hram to Bhrigire, salutations.

original: oṃ hrā vināyakāya namaḥ // oṃ hrā mahyai namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrā vināyakāya namaḥ om hrā mahyai namaḥ
translated: Om Hram to Vinayaka, salutations. Om Hram to Mahi, salutations.

analyzed: om hrā narmadāyai namaḥ dhvaja
translated: Om Hram to Narmada, salutations. In the flag.

original: oṃ hrā mrū daṇḍāya phaṇnamaḥ // patākā //
analyzed: om hrā mrū daṇḍāya phaṭ namaḥ patākā
translated: Om Hram Rhum to Danda, salutations. Flag.

analyzed: om hrā puṇḍalīkāyai namaḥ
translated: Om Hram to Pundarika, salutations.

original: p / oṃ hrā yamāya mahiṣāsanāya namaḥ // dhyānaṃ //
analyzed: om hrā yamāya mahiṣa āsanāya namaḥ dhyānam
translated: Om Hram to Yama, seated on a buffalo, salutations. Meditation.

analyzed: mahiṣa āsanam ārūḍham daṇḍa hastam su śobhanam
translated: Seated on a buffalo, with a staff in hand, very beautiful,
Having the luster of black collyrium, salutations to you, Dharmaraja.

original: oṃ hrā muṃ yamāya namaḥ // vali //
analyzed: om hrā muṃ yamāya namaḥ vali
translated: Om Hram Mum to Yama, salutations. Offering.

original: oṃ hrā kolāpurāgnijihvācaṇḍebhyaḥ valiṃ gṛhna svāhā
analyzed: om hrā kolāpura agnijihvā caṇḍebhyaḥ valim gṛhna svāhā
translated: Om Hram to the fierce tongues of the fire in the city of Kola, accept the offering, svaha.

analyzed: svarūpa ādi stuti antam
translated: From the form to the end of praise.

analyzed: namaḥ astu yama rājāya dakṣiṇa adhipati īśvara
translated: Salutations to King Yama, the lord of the southern direction.

original: yajñānāṃ vighnanāśāya rakṣarthaṃ sannidhī bhava // astragandhādi //
analyzed: yajñānām vighna nāśāya rakṣa artham sannidhī bhava astra gandha ādi
translated: For the destruction of obstacles to sacrifices, be present for protection. Weapons, incense, etc.
The offering with Shveta. Door worship method. Santanairiti.

original: oṃ hrā kīrtitoraṇāya namaḥ // oṃ hrā kīrtidvārāya namaḥ //

Bali. Aghora. Six limbs. Invocation etc. Yoni khaḍga mudrā.

analyzed: bhagavati mahābhairava rūpa dhāriṇī tridaśa vara namite sakala mantra māta

translated: where is Viṣṇu, where is Indra, where is the moon, where are the gods and demons?
The one who is delighted by the dance at the end of the kalpa, the lord of the siddhis, the king of the play and dance,
the god Mahābhairava is victorious!

analyzed: ai hū mahākāra mahābhairavāya sarva śatru pramathanī svāhā
translated: Ai Hū - to the great form, the great Bhairava, the destroyer of all enemies, Svāhā!

analyzed: mahākālam mahāraudram mahā kṛṣṇa añjana prabham
translated: The great time, the great fierce one, having the luster of great black collyrium,

analyzed: sthūla rūpam mahā kāyam kartṛ kāpāla dhāriṇam
translated: The gross-formed one, the great-bodied one, holding a knife and a skull-cup,

analyzed: khaḍga pheṭaka dharam devam trinetram jvalana prabham
translated: The god with three eyes, holding a sword and a shield, having the luster of fire,

analyzed: namaḥ te tu mahākālam śatru saṃhāra kārakam
translated: Salutations to you, O great time, the destroyer of enemies.

analyzed: ugra caṇḍa
translated: Ugracaṇḍa!

original: oṃ hrī rājapra hsphre ugracaṇḍaripumardanī hu phre sadārakṣa tvāṃ
analyzed: om   rājapra   ugra caṇḍa ripu mardanī hu phre sadā rakṣa tvām
translated: Om Hrī Rāja Pra Hshphre Ugracaṇḍa Ripu Mardani Hu Phre Sada Raks Tvam

analyzed: mām jum sam mṛtyu hare svāhā
translated: Om, Jum, Sam, O remover of death, hail!

original: kārkaṇḍeyo vipadupadahatānugrahā yāvatāraṃ cakre yasya cūrṇakaraṇo
translated: Karkandayu, having cut off the calamities of the world, has composed this hymn to the incarnation of Vishnu,

original: vrahmavidvrahmakalpaḥ //🔽daityā cchedapramuditasuraso stotragarbhaprabhāvaḥ soyaṃ devyā bhavatu
analyzed: vrahma vid vrahma kalpaḥ  daityā stotra garbha prabhāvaḥ saḥ yam devyāḥ bhavatu
translated: who is equal to Brahma in knowledge of the Vedas.🔽May this hymn, which contains the essence of the glory of the goddess,

analyzed: bhavatām śreyase caṇḍikāyāḥ
translated: be for the welfare of you all, O goddess Chandika.

analyzed: dayanam ca
translated: And may it be so.

original: oṃ hrā rājaprade hskhphre ugracaṇḍī ripumardanī hū phre satārakṣa tvā
analyzed: om   rāja prade ugracaṇḍī ripu mardanī   phre sa tārakṣa tvā
translated: Om, Hram, to the giver of kingship, Hskhpre, O fierce and terrible one, the crusher of enemies, Hum, Pre, protect me with the stars.

analyzed: mām jum sam mṛtyu hare svāhā
translated: Om, Jum, Sam, O remover of death, hail!
The goddess who crushed Madhu and Kaitabha, who crushed Chandi and Mundari, who is the foremost,

original: mahiṣāsurakṣayakarī prācaṇḍaktavījā śrayā //🔽yāsāśubhadaityadalanīyā devadevāśrayā sā devī mama
analyzed: devadeva āśrayā sā devī mama
translated: who destroyed the demon Mahiṣa, who is the embodiment of fierce energy, who is the refuge of the gods,🔽may that goddess, who is the destroyer of the inauspicious demons, who is the refuge of the gods,

analyzed: rakṣa dakṣiṇa bhujaiḥ caṇḍī tu
translated: may that Chandi, with her right arm, protect me for victory.

analyzed: mūla
translated: The root mantra:

original: ai hrī hū hā phe kṣā namaḥ svāhā // //🔽utphullāṃvuja karṇikoparigatā śrīsiddhilakṣmīḥ parā karpūrasphaṭikendukunda
analyzed: ai hrī hū hā phe kṣā namaḥ svāhā  utphulla aṃvuja karṇikā upari gatā śrī siddhi lakṣmīḥ parā karpūra sphaṭika indu kunda
translated: Om, Hrim, Hum, Hah, Phem, Ksha, salutations, svaha!🔽 The supreme goddess Shri Siddhi Lakshmi, who resides on the pericarp of a blooming lotus, who destroys all the bonds of worldly existence,
who is as white as camphor, crystal, the moon, and the jasmine flower,

analyzed: saṃsāra arṇava duḥkha paṅka dahanī miṣkamyanam sarvadā
translated: The destroyer of the mire of suffering in the ocean of worldly existence, always bestowing happiness,
I pay homage to the glorious one with five faces, ten arms, and a corpse seat.

analyzed: guhyakāli
translated: O Guhyakali!

original: oṃ phe siddhikalāli hrī cchrī hū phe namaḥ svāhā //
analyzed: om phe siddhikalā āli hrī c śrī hū phe namaḥ svāhā
translated: Om phe siddhikalali hri shri hu phe namaḥ svāhā.

analyzed: kuhara utthita bhāsvarūpā soma arka vahni
translated: Whose form arises from the fiery cave of the fire of destruction, the form of the sun and moon,

analyzed: tri patha udara madhya saṃsthā  citta viṣaya ākhya vilīna bhāvā sva abhāva bhāvita parām praṇamāmi
translated: Residing in the middle of the belly of the three paths,🔽I bow to the supreme Kali, whose nature is the dissolution of the mind and sense objects,

analyzed: kālīm
translated: Whose nature is perfected by her own nature.

analyzed: tripura
translated: O Tripura!

analyzed: ai vilhm khl kl hrī vrahmacakre oḍiyāna mahā pīṭhe caryā nātha ātmike
translated: Ai vikh kh khl hri in the Brahma wheel, in the Oddiyana mahapitha, which is of the nature of Caryanatha,
The goddess Shri Maha Tripura Sundari, the supreme Brahman, the power of the self, Shri, svāhā.

original: aindrasyaiva śarāsanasyadadhatīṃ madhye lalāṭe prabhāṃ sau klī
analyzed: aindrasya eva śarāsanasya a dadhatīm madhye lalāṭe prabhām sau klī
translated: Holding in the middle of her forehead the radiance of Indra's bow,

original: kāntimanusthagauri vaśirasyātatvātī sarvataḥ //🔽eṣā srautripurā hṛdidyuti rivoṣṇāṃ śoḥ sadāhaḥ sthitācchidyāvaḥ
analyzed: sarvatas  eṣā srautripurā hṛdidyuti sa dāhaḥ sthitā ācchidyāvaḥ
translated: O Gaurī, with the beauty of the moon, transcending all.🔽This Tripura, residing in the heart like lightning, always burning with heat,

analyzed: sahasā pādaiḥ tribhiḥ agham jyotiḥ mayīm vād mayīm
translated: I suddenly destroy with three feet, the radiant one, full of knowledge.

original: māyā kuṇḍalinīkriyā madhumatī kālīkalāmālinī mātaṅgī vijayājayā
translated: Māyā, Kuṇḍalinī, Kriyā, Madhumatī, Kālī, Kalāmālinī, Mātaṅgī, Vijayā, Jayā,

analyzed: bhagavatī devī śivā śāmbhavī
translated: The Blessed Goddess, Śivā, Śāmbhavī,

original: śaktiḥ śaṃkaravallabhā trinayanī vāgvādinī bhairavī hrī kālī
translated: Śakti, Beloved of Śaṅkara, Three-eyed, Eloquent, Bhairavī, Hrīṃ, Kālī,

analyzed: tripurā pura apara mayī mātā kumārī iti asi
translated: The Mother of the Form of the Supreme Goddess of the Three Cities, the Virgin, thus is it.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus is the concluding oblation. The worship of the Śrī Maṇḍala.

original: asitāṃgādi vrahmāṇyādi //🔽hrā asitāṅgabhairavāya a vrahmāṇīśakti sahitāya svāhā //
analyzed: asitāṃga ādi vrahmāṇī ādi  hrā asita aṅga bhairavāya a vrahmāṇī śakti sahitāya svāhā
translated: Asiteṅga etc., Brahmāṇī etc.🔽Hraṃ to Asiteṅgabhairava, Kaṃ to Brahmāṇī Śakti, Svāhā.

original: hrī rurubhairavāyakaṃ māheśvari śaktisahitāya svāhā //🔽hrū caṇḍabhairavāyacaṃ kaumārī śaktisahitāya svāhā //
analyzed: hrī ruru bhairavāyakam māheśvari śakti sahitāya svāhā  hrū kaumārī śakti sahitāya svāhā
translated: Hrīṃ to Rurubhairava, Khaṃ to Maheśvarī Śakti, Svāhā.🔽Hraūṃ to Caṇḍabhairava, Chaṃ to Kaumārī Śakti, Svāhā.

analyzed: hro vaiṣṇavī śakti sahitāya svāhā
translated: Hroṃ to Krodha Bhairava, Taṃ to Vaiṣṇavī Śakti, Svāhā.

original: hrā unmattabhairavāyataṃ vārāhiśaktisahitāya svāhā //🔽hrāi kapālisabhairavāyapaṃ indrāyaṇī śaktisahitāya svāhā //
analyzed: hrāḥ unmattabhairava āyatam vārāhi śakti sahitāya svāhā  hrāi indrāyaṇī śakti sahitāya svāhā
translated: Hraṃ to Unmattabhairava, Thaṃ to Vārāhī Śakti, Svāhā.🔽Hraḥ to Kapālibhairava, Paṃ to Indrāṇī Śakti, Svāhā.

analyzed: hrā bhīṣaṇa bhairavāya yam cāmuṇḍā śakti sahitāya svāhā
translated: Hraṃ to Bhīṣaṇabhairava, Yaṃ to Cāmuṇḍā Śakti, Svāhā.

analyzed: hrā mahā lakṣmī śakti sahitāya svāhā
translated: HRAUM to the destroyer Bhairava, along with the power of great Lakshmi, SVAHAM.

analyzed: indrāṇi
translated: Indrani.

original: khphre indrāya svāhā // a agnaye svāhā //
analyzed: indrāya svāhā a agnaye svāhā
translated: KHPHREM to Indra, SVAHAM. A to Agni, SVAHAM.

original: yu yamāya svāhā // nu naiṛtyāya svāhā //
analyzed: yu yamāya svāhā nu naiṛtyāya svāhā
translated: YU to Yama, SVAHAM. NU to Nairrita, SVAHAM.

original: vū varuṇāya svāhā // yū vāyave svāhā //
analyzed: vū varuṇāya svāhā yū vāyave svāhā

original: su kuverāya svāhā // i īśānāya svāhā //
analyzed: su kuverāya svāhā i īśānāya svāhā
translated: SU to Kubera, SVAHAM. I to Isana, SVAHAM.

analyzed: a anantāya svāhā va vrahmaṇe svāhā
translated: A to Ananta, SVAHAM. VA to Brahma, SVAHAM. Prayaga.

analyzed: hra varuṇa kṣetrapālāya svāhā  hra kālāpura mahā kṣetrapālāya svāhā
translated: HRAUM to the guardian of the Varuna field, SVAHAM.🔽HRAUM to the great guardian of the Kalapa field, SVAHAM.

analyzed: hra aṭṭahāsa mahā kṣetrapālāya svāhā  hra jayantī mahā kṣetrapālāya svāhā

analyzed: hrā caritra mahā kṣetrapālāya svāhā  hrāḥ ekāsraka mahā kṣetrapālāya svāhā
translated: HRAUM to the great guardian of the Charitra field, SVAHAM.🔽HRAUM to the great guardian of the Ekasraka field, SVAHAM.

analyzed: hrā devī koṭa kṣetrapālāya svāhā  hrāḥ hetuka kṣetrapālāya svāhā

translated: HRAUM to the guardian of the Tripurantaka field, SVAHAM.🔽HRAUM to the guardian of the Agnivetala field, SVAHAM.

analyzed: hrāḥ agni jihvā kṣetrapālāya svāhā
translated: HRAUM to the guardian of the Agnijihva field, SVAHAM.

analyzed: hrā kālākṣa kṣetrapālāya svāhā
translated: HRA KALAAKSHAKSHETRAPALAAYA SVAHAA.

analyzed: hrā kālīna kṣetrapālāya svāhā  hrāḥ ekapāda kṣetrapālāya svāhā

translated: HRA GAGANAKSHETRAPALAAYA SVAHAA.

analyzed: hrā ca kaumāridevyai svāhā  hrā ṭa vaiṣṇavī devyai svāhā

analyzed: hrā ta vārāhī devyai svāhā  hrā pa indrāyaṇī devyai svāhā

analyzed: hrā ya cāmuṇḍā devyai svāhā

analyzed: hrā śa mahālakṣmī devyai svāhā

analyzed: śatru nāśanī

original: ai dhā dhāmayai svāhā // dhāmavatyai svāhā //
analyzed: ai dhāḥ dhāmayai svāhā dhāmavatyai svāhā

analyzed: lākinyai svāhā  kmlvryū kākinyai svāhā

analyzed: ai aghore hrau thaghore hsphre ghoraḥ tare hrā hrī sarvatas sarva sarve

analyzed: hrā śivāye hū nāṭeśvarāya kṣā kṣetrapālāya  glū gaṇapataye kṣā kṣetrapālāya masaṃṣu

original: hū cālaṃ keśvarāya kṣāṃ kṣetrapālāya //🔽kaṅgatvasikva //🔽hskṣmlvryū bhūteśvarāya // hū kalaṃkeśvarāya // hrī saḥ nārāyaṇāya //🔽garuḍe // tuyaraju // vidyāpīṭhi // vali // lvahva //🔽gaṇeśa // āgama //🔽rakṣāhuti śaṃkaranārāyaṇa // yakṣeśvara //🔽trivikramenārāyaṇa // hariśaṃkara //🔽oṃ vu varuṇāya // oṃ ṭa vaiṣṇava // ākāśabhairava // vaṃśīdhara ahorātra //🔽iti daśāpātanavidhi //🔽vahirdvārāṅgamālakoviya // thavadeguliyāmālakvaviya //🔽śrīdumāju //🔽vaṃkrasvayā // māneśvarīyā // pithuya //🔽tayā khāḍhāvavimāhe //🔽kṣamāsviti pūṇāvākyaṃ paṭhet //
analyzed: hū ca alam keśvarāya kṣām kṣetrapālāya 🔽kaṅ ga tva si kva 🔽bhūteśvarāya hū kalaṃkeśvarāya hrī saḥ nārāyaṇāya 🔽R garuḍe vidyāpīṭhi vali 🔽gaṇeśa āgama 🔽rakṣā āhuti śaṃkara nārāyaṇa yakṣeśvara 🔽trivikramenārāyaṇa hari śaṃkara 🔽om varuṇāya om vaiṣṇava ākāśabhairava vaṃśīdhara ahorātra 🔽iti daśa āpātana vidhi 🔽vahis dvāra aṅga mālakoviya 🔽śrī duma aju 🔽vaṃkra svayā māneśvarīyā 🔽tayā 🔽kṣamāsu iti pūṇā vākyam paṭhet

original: ai vrahamā viṣnumaheśaṃ surapatidahanaṃ kālarakṣapracetā vātoyakṣendra
analyzed: ai viṣnu maheśam surapati dahanam kālarakṣa pracetāḥ vātoyakṣa indra
translated: Brahmā, Viṣṇu, Maheśa, lord of gods, fire, Kāla, Rakṣa, Pracetā, Vāta, Yakṣa, Indra,

analyzed: nāgā grahaṇa bhū divā rātri yoga ādi lagnā
translated: Nāga, Agrapana, Bhū, Divā, Rātri, Yoga, Lagna,

original: yocintyaṣṭā jalādyā gaṇapativaṭukā kṣetrapālādi sarve te sarve santuśāntiṃ
analyzed: jala ādyā gaṇapati vaṭukā kṣetrapāla ādi sarve te sarve santu śāntim
translated: And the eight planets beginning with Jupiter, Gaṇapati, Vaṭuka, Kṣetrapāla, and all others, may they all be peaceful,

analyzed: su abhimata phala dāḥ ājya pūrṇā hutena svāhā
translated: May they bestow the desired fruits with the oblation of ghee, svāhā.

analyzed: prāṇa ghana adhi rūḍhā a bhuja daśaka yutā pañca vaktrā tri netrā vrahmagranthīm
translated: Established in the dense life force, endowed with ten arms, five faces, three eyes,

original: vibhedyaprakatitanilaye hṛtsarojevasantī //🔽icchusthā vinduśubhrātvamṛtamayatanu viśvasvargāpavargā pātu🔽śrīsiddhilakṣmī hyabhimataphadā sthūlarūpaṃ vicintya //
analyzed: vibhedya prakatita nilaye  icchu sthā vindu śubhrātu amṛta maya tanu viśva svarga apavargā pātu  śrī siddhilakṣmī hi abhimata phadā sthūla rūpam vicintya
translated: Having pierced through the knot of Brahmā, dwelling in the lotus of the heart, the natural abode,🔽May the auspicious bindu-white nectar-formed body, the bestower of the worlds, heaven, and liberation,🔽The glorious goddess of accomplishments, the giver of desired fruits, be contemplated in gross form.

analyzed: devīm caṃdrikā upari saṃsthitā
translated: The goddess residing on the moon,

analyzed: tri pañca netra saṃyuktām daśa vāhu mahā vālām  iti ghṛta āhuti pūrṇā yuktiḥ
translated: Endowed with three or five eyes, with ten arms, and great valor.🔽Thus, with the oblation of ghee, the reasoning is complete.

original: mūlagāyatrī pūrvakaṃ // oṃ agnaye svāhā // ghṛtena idamagnaye // evaṃ //
analyzed: mūla gāyatrī pūrvakam om agnaye svāhā ghṛtena idam agnaye evam
translated: The original Gāyatrī, Om, svāhā to Agni, with ghee this is for Agni, and so on.

original: somāya svāhā // varuṇāya svāhā // yajñāya svāhā //
analyzed: somāya svāhā varuṇāya svāhā yajñāya svāhā
translated: To Soma, svāhā! To Varuṇa, svāhā! To Yajña, svāhā!

original: bhīmāya svāhā // ugrāya svāhā // śatakratave svāhā // vyuhyai svāhā //
analyzed: bhīmāya svāhā ugrāya svāhā śatakratave svāhā vyuhyai svāhā
translated: To Bhīma, svāhā! To Ugra, svāhā! To Śatakratu, svāhā! To Vyūha, svāhā!

original: svargāya svāhā // oṃ agnaye sviṣṭikṛtaye svāhā //
analyzed: svargāya svāhā om agnaye su iṣṭi kṛtaye svāhā
translated: To Svarga, svāhā! Om to Agni Sviṣṭakṛt, svāhā!

analyzed: vrahma apraṇīta lokapāla dvāla kalaśa yakṣa yakṣaṇī nāga śrī lakṣmī
translated: To Agni, Veda, Brahmā, Praṇīta, Lokapāla, Dvāla, Kalaśa, Yakṣa, Yakṣiṇī, Nāga, Śrī, Lakṣmī,

analyzed: gaṇa guru yoginī astra vāstu śiva śakti sthaṇḍila mūla kalaśa vali
translated: Gaṇa, Guru, Yoginī, Aṣṭra, Vastu, Śiva, Śakti, Sthaṇḍila, Mūla, Kalaśa, Bali,

analyzed: sva sva mantreṇa stotreṇa ghṛtā ā huti krameṇa tila āhutim dadet
translated: With one's own mantra and hymn, one should offer ghee oblations and sesame seed oblations in sequence.

original: trayamvā // pañca vā // daśam vā // deśā pātana // kārā pātanāhuti //
analyzed: trayamvā pañca vā daśamvā
translated: Three, five, or ten oblations for pacifying the country and prison.

analyzed: atha caru sādhanam astra mantreṇa dhānyam ādāya
translated: Now, the preparation of the oblation. Taking grains with the weapon mantra,

original: ai khphre sakalaśatru prathamani anantaśaktidhāmne astrāya phaṭ //
analyzed: ai khphre ananta śakti dhāmne astrāya phaṭ
translated: Ai khphre, to all enemies, the abode of infinite power, to the weapon, phaṭ!

analyzed: kavacena juṭṭanam
translated: Enveloping with the armor mantra,

original: khphre sakaladuritā riṣṭakleśadalani svatantraśaktidhāmne kavacāya hū //
analyzed: sakala duritā riṣṭa kleśa dalani svatantra śakti dhāmne kavacāya hū
translated: Khphre, to all calamities, misfortune, and afflictions, to the independent power, to the armor, hū!

analyzed: yena sūrya tridhāya
translated: With the three-fold sun mantra,

analyzed: khphre paramahaṃsini sarvajñātā śakti dhāmne hṛdayāya namaḥ
translated: KSHRE PARAMAHAMSINI SARVAJNATA SHAKTIDHANI HRIYAYA NAMAH.

analyzed: astreṇa tu
translated: With the weapon mantra, one should sprinkle water on the food.

analyzed: tām apātrenidhyāya
translated: One should meditate on it in a vessel.

original: agnikuṇḍasamepiṃkāyāvaye kulī sa cūlīsate //🔽mūlamantreṇa ṣaḍaṅgaṇapūnayāya // calupātracchuḥ // carukvakāsyaṃte //
analyzed: kulī sa  mūlamantreṇa ṣaḍaṅgaṇa pūnayāya
translated: In the fire pit, one should place the body with the head facing east.🔽With the root mantra, one should purify the six limbs and the vessel.

analyzed: pūjanam ṣaḍaṅgeṇa āvāhana ādi
translated: After the worship with the six limbs, one should perform the invocation and other rites.

analyzed: yakṣa mudrām darśayet śuñcati
translated: One should show the Yaksha mudra and recite the mantra for the offering of the cooked rice.

analyzed: kalaśa pratiṣṭhāḥ pati sthitaḥ asi ityādi
translated: The installation of the water pot should be done with the mantra You are established... etc.

analyzed: saṃkhyā homa mūlamantreṇa
translated: The number of oblations should be done with the root mantra.

analyzed: iti tila āhuti pūrṇā kārayet
translated: Thus, one should offer the oblations of sesame seeds and complete the ritual.

analyzed: ai śakra ādyā lokapālā pitṛ gaṇa sahitā mātaraḥ bhairava aṣṭau rakṣā bhūtaḥ
translated: The statement is: AIE SHAKRA AND OTHER WORLD GUARDIANS, TOGETHER WITH THE GHOSTS AND SPIRITS, THE MOTHERS, THE EIGHT BHAIRAVAS, THE PROTECTORS,

analyzed: piśācāḥ vaṭuka giri varāḥ preta nāga ādi yakṣāḥ
translated: THE GHOSTS, THE NOBLE VATSAS AND JAKSAS, THE PRETAS AND NAGAS,

original: devī śrīsiddhilakṣmī sagaṇaparivṛtā maṇḍale sthaṇḍilesthāte śāntiṃ
analyzed: devī śrī siddhilakṣmī sa gaṇa parivṛtā maṇḍale śāntim
translated: THE GODDESS SHRI SIDDHI LAKSHMI, SURROUNDED BY HER FOLLOWERS, STANDS IN THE MANDALA ON THE ALTAR, ALWAYS OFFERING PEACEFUL

analyzed: ca pūrṇā kṛtena svāhā
translated: OBLAIONS OF SESAME SEEDS AND COMPLETING THE FULL OBLAION, SVAH.

analyzed: sarva śatru pramardantīm durita akleśa nāśinīm
translated: She who crushes all enemies and destroys misfortune and afflictions,

analyzed: pratyaṃgirām namasyāmi siddhi lakṣmīm jaya pradām
translated: I bow to Pratyangira, the bestower of accomplishments, glory and victory.

analyzed: iti tatas caru homaḥ
translated: Thus, the full (rite). Then the charu oblation.🔽Mixed with ghee, sugar and honey.

analyzed: ghṛta śarkarā madhu miśrayet svāhā om somāya svāhā
translated: Om to Soma, svaha.

analyzed: varuṇāya svāhā
translated: To Varuna, svaha.

original: oṃ yajñāya svāhā // oṃ bhīmāya svāhā // ugrāya svāhā //
analyzed: om yajñāya svāhā  om bhīmāya svāhā ugrāya svāhā
translated: Om to Yajna, svaha. Om to Bhima, svaha. To Ugra, svaha.

original: śatakratave svāhā // vyuvdyai svāhā // svargāya svāhā // oṃ agnayesviṣṭikṛtaye
analyzed: śatakratave svāhā vyuvdyai svāhā svargāya svāhā om agnaye su iṣṭi kṛtaye
translated: To Shatakratu, svaha. To Vyudhya, svaha. To Svarga, svaha. Om to Agni Svistakrit,

analyzed: svāhā
translated: Svaha. To the nine planets.

analyzed: om hrā saḥ ādityāya svāhā
translated: Om Hra Srah to Aditya, svaha.

original: oṃ ṣrā ṣrī ṣro saḥ somāya svāhā // payerasi //
analyzed: om saḥ somāya svāhā
translated: Om Srah Sree Srah to Soma, svaha. To the milk.

original: oṃ krā krī kro saḥ aṃgārāya svāhā // apāmārga //
analyzed: om krā krī kro saḥ aṃgārāya svāhā apāmārga
translated: Om Kra Kree Krah to Angaraka, svaha. To Apamarga.

original: oṃ vrā vrī vrū saḥ vudhāya svāhā // dumvari //
analyzed: om vrā vrī vrū saḥ vudhāya svāhā dumvari
translated: Om Vrah Vree Vrah to Budha, svaha. To Dumvari.

original: oṃ hrā hrī hrū saḥ vṛhaspataye svāhā // valaṃgatasi //🔽oṃ drā drī drū saḥ śukrāya svāhā // sanīkaṇṭhasi //
analyzed: om hrā hrī hrū saḥ vṛhaspataye svāhā  om drā drī drū saḥ śukrāya svāhā
translated: Om Hra Hri Hrah to Brihaspati, svaha. To Valangata.🔽Om Dra Dree Drah to Shukra, svaha. To Sanikantasi.

original: oṃ śrā śrī śrū saḥ śanaiścarāya svāhā // durvā //
analyzed: om śrā śrī śrū saḥ śanaiścarāya svāhā
translated: Om Srah Sree Srah to Shani, svaha. To Durva.

original: oṃ bhrā bhrī bhrū saḥ rāhave svāhā // aśva //
analyzed: om bhrā bhrī bhrū saḥ rāhave svāhā aśva
translated: Om bhra bhrī bhruḥ saḥ to Rahu, Svāhā. Aśva.

original: oṃ phrā phrī phro saḥ ketave svāhā // vaṭasi //
analyzed: om phrā phrī phro saḥ ketave svāhā vaṭasi
translated: Om phra phrī phruḥ saḥ to Ketu, Svāhā. Vaṭasi.

original: oṃ jrā jrī jro saḥ janmane svāhā // valena //
analyzed: om jrā jrī jro saḥ janmane svāhā valena
translated: Om jra jrī jruḥ saḥ to Jñāna, Svāhā. Valeṇa.

analyzed: haya trideva kṣetrajā
translated: The horse is to be released. Tri-deva. Kṣetraja.

original: thhsrau prastaradvīpadambhakī devī mahādhvāka kṣetrapālāya svāhā // vaṭuka
analyzed: thhsrau prastaradvīpadambhakī devī mahādhvāka kṣetrapālāya svāhā vaṭuka
translated: Tṁsrā Prastara-dvīpa-dambakī-devī-mahādhvāka-kṣetrapāla, Svāhā. Vaṭuka.

analyzed: śrī hrī kula putra vaṭuka nāthāya svāhā tatoyā
translated: Śrī hrī kulaputra-vaṭuka-nāthāya, Svāhā. Tatoyā.

original: p / gā gī gū gaḥ glau kulagaṇeśvarāya svāhā // vrahmā //
analyzed: gā gī gū gaḥ glau kula gaṇa īśvarāya svāhā vrahmā
translated: Ga gī gū gaḥ glaum to Kula-gaṇeśvara, Svāhā. Brahma.

analyzed: om vrahmaṇe svāhā praṇīta
translated: Om to Brahma, Svāhā. Prāṇīta.

analyzed: om praṇītāya svāhā
translated: Om to Prāṇīta, Svāhā. Veda.

original: oṃ vrahmaṇe svāhā // oṃ siddheśvarāya svāhā //
analyzed: om vrahmaṇe svāhā om siddheśvarāya svāhā
translated: Om to Brahma, Svāhā. Om to Siddheśvara, Svāhā.

original: oṃ śivāya svāhā // oṃ māyāyai svāhā //
analyzed: om śivāya svāhā om māyāyai svāhā
translated: Om to Śiva, Svāhā. Om to Māyā, Svāhā.

analyzed: indrāya svāhā
translated: Druva Indra and others. Lu to Indra, Svāhā.

original: ru agnaye svāhā // mu yamāya svāhā //🔽kṣu naiṛtyāya svāhā // vu varuṇāya svāhā //
analyzed: ru agnaye svāhā mu yamāya svāhā  naiṛtyāya svāhā vu varuṇāya svāhā
translated: Ru to Agni, Svāhā. Mu to Yama, Svāhā.🔽Kṣu to Nairṛta, Svāhā. Vu to Varuṇa, Svāhā.

original: yu vāyuve svāhā // su kuverāya svāhā //
analyzed: su vāyuve svāhā su kuverāya svāhā
translated: Yu to Vāyu, Svāhā. Su to Kubera, Svāhā.

original: hu īśānāya svāhā // a anantāya svāhā //
analyzed: hu īśānāya svāhā a anantāya svāhā
translated: Hu to Īśāna, Svāhā. A to Ananta, Svāhā.

analyzed: om vrahmaṇe svāhā pūrva dvārayā
translated: Om, to Brahman, Svâhâ! (to be recited) at the eastern door.

original: oṃ śāntitoraṇāya svāhā // oṃ sumaṃgaladvārāya svāhā //
analyzed: om śānti toraṇāya svāhā om su maṃgala dvārāya svāhā
translated: Om, to the gate of peace, Svâhâ! Om, to the gate of good luck, Svâhâ!

original: oṃ lu indrāya svāhā // āgneyā //🔽oṃ hrā riddhitoraṇāya svāhā //
analyzed: om lu indrāya svāhā āgneyā  om hrāḥ riddhitoraṇāya svāhā
translated: Om, Lu, to Indra, Svâhâ! (to be recited) at the south-east.🔽Om, Hrâ, to the gate of prosperity, Svâhâ!

analyzed: om hrāḥ riddhidvārāya svāhā
translated: Om, Hrâ, to the gate of prosperity, Svâhâ!

analyzed: om ruṃ agnaye svāhā
translated: Om, Ru, to Agni, Svâhâ! (to be recited) at the south.

analyzed: om vidyā toraṇāya svāhā
translated: Om, to the gate of knowledge, Svâhâ!

original: oṃ suhotradvārāya svāhā // oṃ mu yamāya svāhā // naiṛtyayā //
analyzed: om suhotradvārāya svāhā om yamāya svāhā naiṛtyayā
translated: Om, to the gate of good hearing, Svâhâ! Om, Mu, to Yama, Svâhâ! (to be recited) at the south-west.

original: oṃ hrā kīrtitoraṇāya svāhā // oṃ hrā kārtidvārāya svāhā //
analyzed: om hrā kīrtitoraṇāya svāhā om hrā kārtidvārāya svāhā
translated: Om, Hrâ, to the gate of fame, Svâhâ! Om, Hrâ, to the gate of success, Svâhâ!

original: oṃ kṣu naiṛtyāya svāhā // paścimayo //🔽oṃ nivṛrtitoraṇāya svāhā //
analyzed: om naiṛtyāya svāhā  om nivṛrti toraṇāya svāhā
translated: Om, Ksu, to Nirriti, Svâhâ! (to be recited) at the west.🔽Om, to the gate of cessation, Svâhâ!

analyzed: om kalyāṇadvārāya svāhā
translated: Om, to the gate of welfare, Svâhâ!

original: oṃ hrā va varuṇāya svāhā // vāyuvyā //
analyzed: om hrāḥ varuṇāya svāhā
translated: Om, Hrâ, Va, to Varuṇa, Svâhâ! (to be recited) at the north-west.

original: oṃ hrā puṣṭitoraṇāya svāhā // oṃ hrā puṣṭidvārāya svāhā //
analyzed: om hrā puṣṭi toraṇāya svāhā om hrā puṣṭi dvārāya svāhā
translated: Om, Hrâ, Pu, to the gate of nourishment, Svâhâ! Om, Hrâ, Pu, to the gate of nourishment, Svâhâ!

analyzed: om vāyave svāhā uttarayā
translated: Om, Ya, to Vâyu, Svâhâ! (to be recited) at the north.

original: oṃ pratiṣṭhātoraṇāya svāhā // oṃ ārogyadvārāya svāhā //
analyzed: om pratiṣṭhā toraṇāya svāhā om ārogya dvārāya svāhā
translated: Om, to the gate of support, Svâhâ! Om, to the gate of health, Svâhâ!

analyzed: om su kuverāya svāhā īśānayā
translated: Om, Su, to Kuvera, Svâhâ! (to be recited) at the north-east.

original: oṃ hrā siddhitoraṇāya svāhā // oṃ hrā siddhidvārāya svāhā //
analyzed: om hrā siddhitoraṇāya svāhā om hrā siddhidvārāya svāhā
translated: Om Hram Siddhi Torana (to the successful arch) Svāhā. Om Hram Siddhi Dwāra (to the successful door) Svāhā.

analyzed: om hru īśānāya svāhā
translated: Om Hru Ishāna (to the lord of the northeast) Svāhā. Adhyā.

analyzed: om hrāḥ ūrddhadvārāya svāhā
translated: Om Hram Urdhva Dwāra (to the upward door) Svāhā.

analyzed: om om vrahmaṇe svāhā śiva śakita
translated: Om Om Brahmaṇe (to Brahmā) Svāhā. Shiva Shakiti.

original: oṃ hrā oṃ hu saḥ mṛtyuṃjayāya amṛtīśvarāya mahālakṣmī śaktisahitāya oṃ ju
analyzed: om hrā om hu saḥ mṛtyuṃjayāya amṛtīśvarāya mahālakṣmī śakti sahitāya om ju
translated: Om Hram Om Hu Saḥ to Mṛtyuñjaya (conqueror of death), Amṛtīśvara (lord of immortality), accompanied by Mahālakṣmī Śakti, Om Ju

analyzed: saḥ svāhā gaṇayā
translated: Saḥ Svāhā. Gaṇayā.

analyzed: gā gaṇapataye svāhā
translated: Ga Gaṇapati (to Gaṇeśa) Svāhā. Guruyā.

analyzed: om guru mūrtaye svāhā kṣatrayā
translated: Om Guru Mūrtaye (to the embodiment of the guru) Svāhā. Kṣatra.

analyzed: kṣā kṣatrapālāya svāhā yogiṇīyā
translated: Kṣā Kṣatra Pālāya (to the protector of the warrior class) Svāhā. Yoginī.

analyzed: yā yoginībhyaḥ svāhā
translated: Ya Yoginībhyaḥ (to the yoginīs) Svāhā. Śrī Lakṣmī.

original: śrī mūrtaye svāhā // hrī lakṣmīmūrtaye svāhā // astra //
analyzed: śrī mūrtaye svāhā hrī lakṣmī mūrtaye svāhā astra
translated: Śrī Mūrtaye (to the embodiment of Śrī) Svāhā. Hrī Lakṣmī Mūrtaye (to the embodiment of Lakṣmī) Svāhā. Astra.

analyzed: om   astra kalaśāya svāhā
translated: Om Hram Astra Kalaśāya (to the weapon pot) Svāhā. Vāyuṣu.

original: oṃ hrā hrī hū vāstvādhipataye vrahmaṇe svāhā // / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / //
analyzed: om hrā hrī hū vāstva adhipataye vrahmaṇe svāhā

analyzed: guru mukha vidhinā puṣṭi pūrṇa akṛtena svāhā  candasadātyādi
translated: According to the ritual from the guru's mouth, complete with nourishment, svāhā.🔽The oblations offered in the directions, beginning with the east,

analyzed: pūrva dakṣiṇa tyādi
translated: The oblations offered in the directions, beginning with the southeast,

analyzed: ācārya pūjā
translated: Worship of the teacher,

analyzed: prāyaścitta homam kṛtvā
translated: Having performed the expiatory oblation,

original: oṃ hrā laṃ sadyojātāyapaścimavaktrāya prāyaścittāya svāhā //
analyzed: om hrā laṃ sadyojātāya paścima vaktrāya prāyaścittāya svāhā
translated: Om hrām lam to the western face Sadyojāta, for expiation, svāhā.

original: oṃ hrā vā vāmadevāya uttaravaktrāya prāyaścittāya svāhā //
analyzed: om hrā vā vāmadevāya uttara vaktrāya prāyaścittāya svāhā
translated: Om Hram Vam to Vamadeva, the northern face, for atonement, svaha.

original: oṃ hrā ra aghorāyadakṣiṇavakrāya prāyaścittāya svāhā //🔽oṃ hrā ya tat puruṣāyapūrvaktrāya prāyaścittāya svāhā //
analyzed: om   ra aghorāya dakṣiṇa vakrāya prāyaścittāya svāhā  om hrā ya tat prāyaścittāya svāhā
translated: Om Hram Ra to Aghora, the southern face, for atonement, svaha.🔽Om Hram Yam to Tatpurusha, the eastern face, for atonement, svaha.

original: oṃ hrā kṣa īśānāya ūrddhavaktrāya prāyaścittāya svāhā //
analyzed: om hrā   īśānāya ūrddha vaktrāya prāyaścittāya svāhā
translated: Om Hram Ksha to Isha, the upward face, for atonement, svaha.

analyzed: iti prāyaścitta homa vidhiḥ  homa mūleya
translated: Thus ends the method of atonement homa.🔽The root of homa is the collection of herbs.

original: salāvasacibhāya sarāvasataya //🔽athaḍhoṣadhi // ghṛtaku // duduku // dadhiku // gomutrapla // gomaya // madhuku🔽vrīhiku // mugaku // māṣaku // yavaku // tallulaku // krodravaku //
analyzed: salāvasacibhāya sarāvasataye  atha ḍha uṣadhi ghṛtaku  duduku   dadhiku    gomutrapla gomaya
translated: The vessel with rice and barley.🔽Now the herbs: ghee, curd, milk, curd, cow's urine, cow dung, honey,🔽rice, green gram, black gram, barley, its flour, krodiraka,

original: godhūmaku // raktamāṣaku // lājāku // pṛthukaku // gudaku // śakruku //
translated: wheat, red gram, fried grain, fried flour, anus, saktu,

analyzed: samidha aṣṭādaśa samidhathu    ṣoḍaśa samidhathu
translated: sugar, eighteen kinds of kindling, sixteen kinds of kindling, jaggery rice,
ke, japa, the bearer of the nine-syllabled mantra, the bearer of the garland mantra,

analyzed: ājñā mantrenadhāra
translated: With the mantra of command, he should hold. Thvateja, Parape, Jaamvīragv, Pāṭaka,
Kimvīrgv, Pāṭaka, Vaīlvīrgv, Mugalankv, Nālikelasādavīrgv,

original: pāṭano // dadhnodanaku ke // pakvānnaku geḍha // vadarīphala // priyaṅguphako
translated: Pāṭano, Dadhnodanakuk, Pakvānnakuk, Geḍha, Vadariphala, Priyanguphala,
Sumukhaphala, Śatapuṣpakuk, Śvetatilakuk, Kṛṣṇatila, Pāvasakuk,

original: raktatilaku // rājikāku // pītasarṣapaku // guḍucīku // trikaṭuku // lavanaku //
translated: Raktatilkuk, Rājikakuk, Pītasarṣapkuk, Gudūcikuk, Trikaṭukuk, Lavanakuk,

original: hiṃguḥ vā // rūpakeśarapla // padmakeśalapla // candranaguli // pla //
analyzed: hiṃguḥ vā
translated: Hingu, Rūpakesharapla, Padmakesharapla, Candranaguli, Pla,

original: gugurigurī pla // agurato // karpūrato // kanturamaṃ // śrīkhaṇḍato //
analyzed: agurataḥ   karpūrataḥ    kanturamam   śrīkhaṇḍataḥ
translated: Guggurigurī pla, Aguruta, Karpūrata, Kanturam, Śrīkhaṇḍata,

analyzed: kandagva
translated: Kuṅkumata, Sarvoṣadhipla, Kandarga, Mūlapla, Kadarihaṃ,

analyzed: māturaṃgagva   panasaphakaḥ
translated: Nālikelaśyāḍhā, Māturagavīrgv, Panasaphala, Nānāsēgavīrgv, Vaīlvīrgv,

original: cchyāḍhākapitthaphako // urvārukaphako // triphalāku // ikṣu pu // tāmvulavilā
analyzed: urvāruka phako triphalāku
translated: Śyāḍhākapitthaphala, Urvarukaphala, Triphalā, Iksupla, Tāmbūlavilā,
Pat! Gvayagvay! Moksasilata! Dva! Phalsvana! Pho!🔽Durvakshta! Dudopa! One should offer one hundred and eight oblations.

analyzed: aṣṭottaraśatam juhuyāt ācārya
translated: The preceptor
Other people's intentions and arrogance🔽The oblation of the Vrittikas

analyzed: kṣaṃdāyitāra agni savyāya
translated: To the one who delights in the fire

analyzed: gāyatrī na ja pa ra pe dhāra
translated: The Gayatri mantra, the essence of the Vedas

original: śāntidyaurantarikṣaṃ kṣitirapi ca tathā śāntiratnauṣadhīnāṃ viśvedevāśca
analyzed: śānti dyauḥ antarikṣam kṣitiḥ api ca tathā śānti ratna oṣadhīnām viśvedevāḥ ca
translated: The peace of heaven, the atmosphere, and the earth, and likewise the peace of the precious herbs, and the Vishvedevas

analyzed: śāntiḥ vidhiḥ api
translated: The peace of the ritual, the wind, the fire, and Rudra are also peace.

original: vāṇasyatya praśāntī raviśaśiharistvaṃ ca sohaṃ sa sarvaḥ śāntyāhutyā ca
analyzed: praśāntiḥ ravi śaśi hariḥ tvam ca saḥ ham sa sarvaḥ śānti āhutyā ca
translated: The peace of the arrow, the sun, the moon, and Hari, you are that, I am that, all is that. By the offering of peace

analyzed: yeṣām sva guruka vidhinā śānti pūrṇā su hutyā svāhā
translated: To those whose peace and fullness are offered by the method of their own guru, svāhā.

analyzed: cūlamantreṇa
translated: With the mantra of the topknot.

analyzed: madhye
translated: Oblations of ghee with the nine-syllable mantra. To Indra and others, oblations of ghee in the middle with Savitri.

original: vyāhatihoma // oṃ bhūḥ svāhā // oṃ bhuvaḥ svāhā // oṃ svaḥ svāhā //
analyzed: vyāhati homa om bhūḥ svāhā om bhuvaḥ svāhā om svar svāhā
translated: The oblation of the Vyāhṛtis: Om Bhūḥ svāhā, Om Bhuvaḥ svāhā, Om Svaḥ svāhā.

original: oṃ bhūrbhuvaḥ svaḥ svāhā // ācāryasyaṃ āhutiviya //
analyzed: om bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar svāhā
translated: Om Bhūḥ Bhuvaḥ Svaḥ svāhā. To the preceptor, oblations with Savitri.

original: oṃ hrā hrī hrū ācārya sa mantrasiddhirastu svāhā // //
analyzed: om hrā hrī hrū ācārya sa mantra siddhiḥ astu svāhā
translated: Om Hrah Hri Hru Acharya, may the accomplishment of the mantra be accomplished, Svāhā.

original: ai nūnebhyaḥ svāhā //🔽ai nūnātiriktaṃ juhomi svāhā //
analyzed: ai nūnebhyaḥ svāhā  ai nūna atiriktam juhomi svāhā
translated: Ai to the Nūnebhyaḥ, Svāhā.🔽Ai I offer the excess, Svāhā.

analyzed: ai atiriktam juhomi svāhā
translated: Ai I offer the excess, Svāhā.

original: ai anājñātaṃ yadājñātaṃ tat svarvaṃ kriyatenama svāhā //
analyzed: ai an ājñātam yat ājñātam tat svarvam kriyate nama svāhā
translated: Ai Whatever is unknown is made known, Svāhā.

analyzed: kuṇḍayaḥ agne koṇa sathāpanāyāya
translated: For the establishment of the corners in the fire pit.

original: antarvali vahirvali pradānaṃ vahirvali pātavasapaṃtakoḍhacchoya mālā //
analyzed: antarvali vahirvali pradānam vahirvali mālā
translated: The offering of the inner oblation, the offering of the outer oblation, the protection of the outer oblation, the garland of the burnt offerings.

analyzed: pūjanam
translated: The worship.

original: ai hrā rudebhyaḥ svāhā // pūrva //🔽ai hrā mātṛbhyaḥ svāhā // dakṣiṇe //
analyzed: ai hrā rudebhyaḥ svāhā pūrva  ai hrā mātṛbhyaḥ svāhā dakṣiṇe
translated: Ai Hrah to the Rudras, Svāhā. East.🔽Ai Hrah to the Mothers, Svāhā. South.

original: ai hrā gaṇebhyaḥ svāhā // paścime //🔽ai hrā yakṣebhyaḥ svāhā // uttare //🔽ai hrā grahabhyaḥ svāhā // īśāna //
analyzed: ai hrā gaṇebhyaḥ svāhā paścime  ai hrā yakṣebhyaḥ svāhā uttare  ai hrā grahabhyaḥ svāhā īśāna
translated: Ai Hrah to the Ganas, Svāhā. West.🔽Ai Hrah to the Yakshas, Svāhā. North.🔽Ai Hrah to the Planets, Svāhā. Northeast.

analyzed: ai hrā asurebhyaḥ svāhā ā agnau
translated: Ai Hrah to the Asuras, Svāhā. Southeast.

original: ai hrā rakṣebhyaḥ svāhā // naiṛtye //🔽ai hrā nāgebhyaḥ svāhā // vāyau //
analyzed: ai hrā rakṣebhyaḥ svāhā naiṛtye  ai hrā nāgebhyaḥ svāhā vāyau
translated: Ai Hrah to the Rakshasas, Svāhā. Southwest.🔽Ai Hrah to the Nagas, Svāhā. Northwest.

original: ai hrā kṣetrebhyaḥ svāhā // madhya //🔽ai hrā rāśibhyaḥ svāhā // ūrddha //
analyzed: ai hrā kṣetrebhyaḥ svāhā madhya  ai hrā rāśibhyaḥ svāhā ūrddha
translated: Ai Hrah to the Kshetras, Svāhā. Center.🔽Ai Hrah to the Rashis, Svāhā. Above.

analyzed: ai hrā viśvebhyaḥ svāhā adha
translated: Ai Hrah to the Vishvas, Svāhā. Below.

analyzed: iti antarvaliḥ
translated: This is the inner oblation.

analyzed: atha vadbhiḥ vali indra ādi navi
translated: Then, the oblations are offered to Indra and others.

analyzed: ai indrāya svāhā
translated: Ai to Indra, Svāhā!

original: ai hrā agnaye svāhā //🔽ai hrā yamāya svāhā //
analyzed: ai hrāḥ agnaye svāhā  ai hrā yamāya svāhā
translated: Ai Hrā to Agni, Svāhā!🔽Ai Hrā to Yama, Svāhā!

original: ai hrā naiṛtyāya svāhā //🔽ai varuṇāya svāhā //🔽ai hrā ya vāyave svāhā //
analyzed: ai hrā naiṛtyāya svāhā  ai varuṇāya svāhā  ai hrā ya vāyave svāhā
translated: Ai Hrā to Nairṛta, Svāhā!🔽Ai to Varuṇa, Svāhā!🔽Ai Hrā to Vāyu, Svāhā!

analyzed: ai hrā kuverāya svāhā
translated: Ai Hrā to Kubera, Svāhā!

original: ai hrā īśānāya svāhā //🔽ai hrā vrahmaṇe svāhā //
analyzed: ai hrāḥ īśānāya svāhā  ai hrā vrahmaṇe svāhā
translated: Ai Hrā to Īśāna, Svāhā!🔽Ai Hrā to Brahmā, Svāhā!

analyzed: ai hrā viṣṇave svāhā
translated: Ai Hrā to Viṣṇu, Svāhā!

analyzed: ai hrā kṣetrapālāya svāhā
translated: Ai Hrā to Kṣetrapāla, Svāhā!

analyzed: dātesaviya  ai hrāḥ odyāna pīṭhāya svāhā pūrva
translated: To the giver, to the goddess.🔽Ai Hrā to the Oddiyāna Pīṭha, Svāhā! (East)

analyzed: ai hrā jālaṃdhara pīṭhāya svāhā dakṣiṇa
translated: Ai Hrā to the Jālandhara Pīṭha, Svāhā! (South)

analyzed: ai hrā pūrṇagiri pīṭhāya svāhā
translated: Ai Hrā to the Pūrṇagiri Pīṭha, Svāhā! (West)

analyzed: ai hrā kāmarūpa pīṭhāya svāhā uttara
translated: Ai Hrā to the Kāmarūpa Pīṭha, Svāhā! (North)

analyzed: lokapāla āduva
translated: The outer oblation is offered to the Lokapālas.

analyzed: dhūpa dīpa dvaya vali haraṇam
translated: The offering of incense and two lamps.

analyzed: ācārya dakṣiṇā dānam
translated: The offering of fees to the teacher.

analyzed: vācanaṃtaya śiva śakti yāddhavane
translated: The recitation of the mantra of Śiva and Śakti.

analyzed: parivāra pūjā
translated: The oblation of the offerings of sorrow and suffering. The worship of the retinue.

analyzed: atha dina pūrṇāḥ āhutim kārayet
translated: Then, on the full day, the Āhuti should be performed.

original: navakṣarī mantreṇa āhutiṃ dhāra //🔽śruvāsa vyelaghāpalathaṃ nesvānamālatruvāsathaṃ thukvahāyakaṃtayāva🔽aduvālataye //🔽yajamānanu dhanarajonakaṃ taya //🔽śruk śruvājoḍhāva vapadaṃ ḍhāvanābhivulinadivakaṃ tayāva // vāhya //🔽śrīsaṃvartāmaṇḍalānte kramapadanihitānandaśaktiḥ subhīmāsṛṣṭaṃ🔽nyāyecaṣkaṃ hyakulakulagataṃ pañcakaṃ cānyaṣaṭkaṃ /
