analyzed: tri pañca netra saṃyuktām daśa vāhu mahā valām
translated: Endowed with three or five eyes, with ten arms, and great strength,

analyzed: saṃghaṭṭa caṇḍaiḥ tvām kālim
translated: I praise you, Kali, with the loud sound of the churning of the ocean, frightening with the loud sound of the churning of the ocean,

analyzed: stotrayaṃtī sakala vivudha hṛd koṭara ālī na liṅga
translated: The Kali who resides in the cavity of the heart of all the gods,

analyzed: sā aghorā
translated: The Kali who is more terrible than the terrible, who brings about the destruction of the entire universe,

analyzed: pāyāt vā avalgamānā kula kamala vana uṭbhāsakā siddha kālī
translated: May the Siddha Kali, who shines like a lotus grove, protect you, dancing with two arms.

analyzed: ai
translated: Ai hskṣmrvrū śkṣmrvrī - the garland mantra.

original: ai hrī śrī khphre hskau oṃ namaḥ sarva siddhiyoginibhyo namaḥ sarva siddhi
analyzed: ai hrī śrī khphre hskau om namaḥ sarva siddhi yoginibhyaḥ namaḥ sarva siddhi
translated: Ai hrīṃ śrīṃ kṣhphre hskrau - Oṃ, salutations to all the accomplished yoginīs, salutations to all the accomplished

analyzed: mātṛbhyaḥ namaḥ nitya uditā nanda naṃditāyai śakala kula cakra nāyikāyai bhagavatyai
translated: mothers. Salutations to the ever-arisen one, delighted by joy, the leader of the circle of the Śākta Kula, to the Blessed One,

original: caṇḍakāpārinyai tadyathāṃ oṃ hrī hū hā phre kṣo kro namaḥ🔽paramahaṃsini nirvāṇamārgadevi ṣamopaplava praśamani sakaladuritā
analyzed: tat yathām om hrī hū hā phre    namaḥ  paramahaṃsini nirvāṇa mārga devi ṣama upaplava praśamani sakala duritā
translated: to Caṇḍakāpālinī. Thus: Oṃ hrīṃ hūṃ hā phre kṣo kraṃ - salutations.🔽O Supreme Swan, the guide on the path to liberation, the pacifier of all calamities, the destroyer of all misfortunes,

original: riṣṭakleśadalani sarvā padāmbhodhitaraṇi śakalaśatruprathamani devī āgaccha
analyzed: riṣṭa kleśa dalani sarvā pada ambhodhi taraṇi śakala śatru prathamani devī āgaccha
translated: miseries, and obstacles, the one who crosses the ocean of existence, the leader of the Śākta Kula, O Goddess, come here!

original: hasa valā nararudhirāntavasā bhakṣaṇi mamasvaśatrun marda khāhi
analyzed: hasa valā nara rudhira anta vasā bhakṣaṇi mamasva śatrun marda khāhi
translated: Laugh, O Bala, drink the marrow and blood of men, crush my enemies, kill!

original: triśūlena bhiṃdhi cchindhi khaḍgena tāḍaye cchetraye tāvadyāvat
analyzed: triśūlena bhiṃdhi chindhi khaḍgena tāḍaye chetraye tāvat yāvat
translated: With the trident, pierce and split, with the sword, strike and cut until

analyzed: mama sakala manorathān sādhaya parama kāruṇike bhagavati
translated: my every wish is fulfilled, O greatly compassionate Blessed One!

analyzed: mahābhairava rūpa dhāriṇi tridaśa vara namite sakala mantra māta praṇata jana vatsale
translated: Bearing the form of the great Bhairava, bowed to by the best of the thirty gods, mother of all mantras, loving towards those who are devoted,

original: devi mahākālikālanāśanī oṃ hū hū hū prasīdamadanāturā hrī kuru
analyzed: devi mahākāli kālanāśanī om hū hū hū prasīda madana āturā hrī kuru
translated: O Goddess, destroyer of the great dark age, Om, Hum, Hum, be gracious, afflicted by passion, Hrim, do!

original: surāsurakanyakāṃ hrī śrī hū phaṭ svāhā vauṣaṭ doye //
analyzed: sura asura kanyakām hrī śrī hū phaṭ svāhā vauṣaṭ doye
translated: To the daughter of the gods and demons, Hrim, Shri, Hum, Phat, Svaha, Vauṣaṭ, Do ye!

analyzed: praṇamya candana ādi pradānam atha āsaṃsāślokam  paṭhet
translated: Having bowed, with the mantra, offer sandalwood paste and other things, then recite the praise verses.

original: śivaśaktiyā // mūrtistvaṃ devatānāṃ sakalasuranadī tīrthagaṅgāditoyaiḥ🔽pūrṇaṃ ratnauṣadhībhiḥ phalakusumayutaiścchatrasat pallavena // vighnānāṃ
analyzed: mūrtiḥ tvam devatānām sakala sura nadī tīrtha gaṅgā ādi toyaiḥ  pūrṇam ratna oṣadhībhiḥ phala kusuma yutaiḥ chatra sat pallavena vighnānām
translated: You are the form of the deities, filled with the waters of all the celestial rivers and the Ganges,

original: dhvasahetuṃ kalikaluṣaharaṃ sarva yajñe prasastaṃ taṃvandekumbharūpaṃ
analyzed: dhvasa hetum kali kaluṣa haram yajñe prasastam
translated: with jewels, herbs, fruits, and flowers, with an excellent umbrella and sprouts, the cause of the destruction of obstacles, the remover of the impurities of the age of discord, praised in all sacrifices, I bow to that form of the pot,

analyzed: maṅgalam maṅgalānām
translated: May it be auspicious, endowed with Shiva, Shakti, and Tiya. The blooming lotus, etc.

analyzed: pūrva dvāra toraṇayā
translated: To the arch of the eastern door.

analyzed: namaḥ stute sacī nātha pūrva adhipatiḥ īśvara
translated: Salutations to you, the lord of Sachi, the presiding deity of the east.

analyzed: yajña yāga iṣu karmāṇi rakṣā artham saṃnidhī bhave
translated: Be present for the protection of the sacrificial rites.

analyzed: dakṣiṇa dvāra toraṇāya
translated: To the arch of the southern door.

analyzed: namaḥ astu yama rājāya dakṣiṇa adhipati īśvara
translated: Salutations to the king of Yama, the presiding deity of the south.

analyzed: yajñānām vighna āśāya rakṣā artham sannidhībhava
translated: For the destruction of obstacles in sacrifices, be present for protection.

analyzed: paścima dvāra toraṇāya
translated: To the arch of the western door.

analyzed: namaḥ stute jala adhīśa tvaritam yajña rakṣaka
translated: Salutations to you, the lord of waters, the swift protector of sacrifices.

analyzed: varuṇam ca mahādeva rakṣā artham sannidhī bhava
translated: O great god Varuna, be present for protection.

analyzed: uttara dvāra toraṇayā
translated: To the arch of the northern door.

analyzed: namaḥ stute dhanādhyakṣa kuvera adhipate prabho
translated: Salutations to you, the lord of wealth, the master of Kubera, O lord.

analyzed: pātāsvam iha yajñānām dhana adhipataye namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the lord of wealth, the protector of sacrifices here.

analyzed: maṇḍalam kṛtvā
translated: Having made the mandala.

original: indrādyāḥ lokapālāḥ sva sva digavasitā svasvamudrā svayuktā
analyzed: indra ādyāḥ lokapālāḥ sva sva diś avasitā sva sva mudrā sva yuktā
translated: Indra and other Lokapalas, residing in their respective directions, along with their respective mudras and retinues,

analyzed: āditya ādi graheṇa janma deva sva rūpāḥ
translated: May the Sun and other planets, always residing in their forms as the gods who bestow birth,

analyzed: gaṇa guru vaṭukā sthaṇḍile mātṛkā iva a siddhiḥ śreyaḥ dadātu
translated: May the preceptors of the Gaṇas, the Vātus, the Mātṛkās residing on the sacrificial ground, grant success and welfare

analyzed: bhava tu vasumatī yajñapūrṇā aśubhoḥ tu
translated: in the conjunctions of the Ṛkṣas and on the lunar days. May the earth be prosperous, and may there be auspicious completion of the sacrifice.

analyzed: om namaḥ agnaye
translated: Om, salutations to Agni.

original: tejākṣaṃ khyāntiviśvaṃ bhavakaluṣaharaṃ pāvanaṃ bhūrbhuvaḥ svaḥ
analyzed: teja akṣam khyānti viśvam bhava kaluṣa haram pāvanam bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar
translated: The eye of brilliance, the all-pervading remover of the impurities of worldly existence, the purifier of the worlds of earth, atmosphere and heaven,

original: sarvīyaṃ viśvavyāptaṃ munijana namitaṃ bhāsvaraṃ śaktihastaṃ //
analyzed: sarvīyam viśva vyāptam muni jana namitam bhāsvaram śakti hastam
translated: the all-pervading, the all-embracing, bowed to by the sages, the radiant one with the power in the hand,

analyzed: jantoḥ ca abhyantarātmā kaṇakam apikaram sūkṣma sūkṣma ati sūkṣmam
translated: the inner soul of all beings, the atom, the subtle one, subtler than the subtle,

analyzed: vande varṇāḥ vyahe tum dvija nikhila guruḥ socikeśam bhavantam
translated: I bow to that unborn one, the preceptor of all twice-born ones, the lord with matted hair.

original: suprītā sarvadevā havisakalayutā agnimukṣātibhakṣā hutvā pūrṇāsubhojyaṃ
analyzed: su prītā sarva devāḥ havi sakala yutāḥ agni mukṣā ati bhakṣāḥ hutvā
translated: The delighted gods, along with all the oblations, having offered the oblations to Agni, the eater of oblations, and having eaten the food in the Pūrṇāhuti,

original: sakalaśubhadayā śāntikaṃ puṣṭikaṃ syāt //🔽santoṣātasya sarve abhimataphaladā sarvasiddhiṃ dadantutān devīṃ
analyzed: sakala śubha dayā śāntikam puṣṭikam syāt  sarve abhimata phala dā sarva siddhim dadantu tān devīm
translated: may there be peace and prosperity, and nourishment.🔽By the satisfaction of him, may all the gods grant the desired fruits and all accomplishments. I bow with devotion to that goddess

analyzed: naumi bhaktyā sakala sura gaṇāḥ yajña rūpī namaḥ astu
translated: who is in the form of sacrifice, to whom the hosts of all gods offer salutations.
Brahmā, Viṣṇu, the flaming trident-holder Śiva, the wind-god, the lord of wealth Kubera,

analyzed: rakṣaḥ ca ananta durgāḥ graha gaṇa sahitam santatam nāgāḥ
translated: The Rakshasas, Ananta, Durga, the groups of planets, all the Nagas,

analyzed: heramva asiddhi saṃghāḥ durita bhaya harāḥ candra sūrya ādi devāḥ yoginyaḥ
translated: The groups of Siddhas residing in the Himalayas, the gods who remove the fear of sins, the gods like Chandra, Surya, the Yoginis,

analyzed: sarva devāḥ sura gaṇa sahitāḥ devāḥ
translated: All the gods, along with the groups of gods, should protect you all.

analyzed: ṛgvedaḥ yasya pādaḥ yajuḥ apara padaḥ sāmaveda atha hastau eṣa atharvaḥ dvitīyam
translated: The Rig Veda is his foot, the Yajur Veda is his other foot, the Sama Veda is his hands, this is the second Atharva

analyzed: śatapatha vadanam vyāhatī vrahma ghoṣam
translated: With a hundred paths, the face, the Vyahrtis, and the loud chanting of the Vedas.

analyzed: gāyatrī yasya gātram
translated: The Gayatri is his body, the eyes are the Upanishads, the tusk is the Brahman,

original: viṣṇupracchannamūrtirbhavati vasumatī yajñarūpīvarāhaḥ //🔽yedevāyakṣanāgā grahaṇasakalā bhūtarakṣaḥ pisācā /
analyzed: viṣṇu pracchanna mūrtiḥ bhavati vasumatī yajña rūpī varāhaḥ  ye deva a yakṣa nāgāḥ grahaṇa sakalāḥ bhūta rakṣaḥ pisācā
translated: The form covered by Vishnu, the earth is in the form of a sacrifice, the boar.🔽The gods, Yakshas, Nagas, all the planets, the Bhutas, Rakshasas, and Pisachas,

original: ye varṣāye ca māsātithigaṇasakalāye ca nakṣatrayogāḥ //
analyzed: ye ca nakṣatra yogāḥ
translated: The years, the months, the groups of lunar days, and the conjunctions of the stars,

analyzed: aka caṭa ta paya sāvarṇa sugrīva caṇḍā
translated: The Lagna, Karna, Vela, the vowels A, Ka, Ca, Ta, Pa, Ya, Savarna, Sugriva, Chanda,

analyzed: su prītāḥ santu nityam niruja sukha padam
translated: May they always be well-pleased, may they be free from disease and happy, may the royal glory be established.

analyzed: kuṇḍa madhye vahnikuṇḍeṣu sthāpye
translated: Placed in the middle of the pit, placed in the fire pits with the sound of Nala reeds,

original: garbhādhānādi pūrvaṃ hṛdayaprabhṛtayaḥ śaktisaṃyogakarma //🔽ojāpūkā ca vedī digapatisagaṇairbhairavaṃ cāṣṭakṣetraṃ /
analyzed: garbhādhāna ādi pūrvam hṛdaya prabhṛtayaḥ śakti saṃyoga karma  ojāpūkā ca vedī digapati sa gaṇaiḥ bhairavam ca aṣṭa kṣetram
translated: The rites of Garbhadhana etc. are performed by the union of Shakti and Shaktimat.🔽The altar is the abode of Ojas, and the eight Bhairava Kshetras are the directions, along with the groups of lords of the directions.

analyzed: yoginyā aṣṭau sa kṣetram vaṭuka gati yutam pātu mām jātavedāḥ
translated: May the eight Kshetras of the Yoginis, along with the path of Vatuka, protect me, O Jatavedas.

analyzed: asmad mantra arthāḥ santu kalasa sthaṇḍila vaiśvānara diś devatā su prītā
translated: May the deities of the directions of the sacrificial ground, the fire, and the pot, which are the objects of our mantras, be well-pleased

analyzed: vara dāḥ bhavantu
translated: and grant us boons.

analyzed: mahāmāyā śrī siddhilakṣmī devyā śrī guhyakālikā
translated: The western Jyeshtha, the great Maya, the goddess Shri Siddhi Lakshmi, the goddess Shri Guhya Kali,

analyzed: devyā śrī tripurasundarī devyāḥ
translated: the goddess Shri Tripura Sundari, the accomplished fire, the sacrifice with the oblation of goat's head meat,

analyzed: nimityā arthena sva sthāna kṣetrapālāya vrahmāṇī ādi asita aṅga mahābhairavāya
translated: for the sake of the purpose of the rite, to the Kshetrapala of one's own place, to the great Bhairava Asitanga, beginning with Brahma,

analyzed: prayāga ādi jaya ādi yoginī sahitāya gaṇa vaṭuka hetukāya sa aṅgāya
translated: to the group of Yoginis beginning with Jaya, along with Ganapati, Vatuka, and Hetuka, with their limbs,

analyzed: sa gaṇa parivārāya diś vidiś indra ādi lokapālāyaḥ su prīta avara dāḥ bhavantu
translated: with their retinue of attendants, to the lords of the directions and intermediate directions, Indra and other world guardians, may they be well-pleased and grant boons.

analyzed: guru vrāhmaṇebhyaḥ śubham bhavatu
translated: May there be auspiciousness to the Guru and Brahmins.

analyzed: ācārya mantra siddhiḥ astu
translated: May there be success in the mantras of the Acharya.

analyzed: rāja adharma vijayī bhavam tu
translated: May the king be victorious in accordance with Dharma.

analyzed: prajāḥ sukhinaḥ santu deśasya śubha udayoḥ tu
translated: May the people be happy and may the country have auspicious rise.

analyzed: sarva satvāḥ sukhī bhavantu
translated: May all beings be happy.

original: paryanyaḥ kālavarṣī bhavatu rāṣṭraḥ śubhaṃ bhavatu dvipadacatuspadānāṃ
analyzed: paryanyaḥ kāla varṣī bhavatu rāṣṭraḥ śubham bhavatu dvipada catuspadānām
translated: May the Parjanya rain at the right time, may the country be auspicious for the two-legged and four-legged,

analyzed: śāntiḥ bhavatu puṣṭiḥ bhavatu
translated: may there be peace, may there be prosperity.

analyzed: devāḥ varṣantu vasudhā sasya sampūrṇa mudrā kṣīra ādyā āsantu
translated: May the gods rain at the right time, may the earth produce crops in abundance, may the cows yield milk and other products,

analyzed: pātu
translated: may the king be wise and protect the earth.

original: sūcyantāṃ sādhuyutrī kulayuvatijanā yātu doṣāvināśaṃ lokānāṃ
analyzed: sūcyantām sādhu yutrī kula yuvati janāḥ yātu doṣa a vināśam lokānām
translated: May the young women of good families be adorned with ornaments, may the people be free from calamities,

analyzed: bhakti bhāvaḥ bhavatu khalu sadā bhaktiḥ eṣā śivoḥ tu
translated: may there be devotion and faith, may there be auspiciousness.

analyzed: rāja adhirāja parameśvara parama bhaṭtāraka
translated: King of kings, supreme lord, great protector,

analyzed: asmad rājya adhipatiḥ śrī śrī sumati jaya jitā mitra mallavartmanaḥ khaḍga siddhiḥ astu
translated: may the lord of our kingdom, the victorious and prosperous one, be successful in the path of friends and rivals. May there be success in the use of the sword.

analyzed: pratāpa udayoḥ tu asmad ādīnām mantra siddhiḥ astu dvipada catuṣpadebhyaḥ śubham
translated: May there be a rise in our glory. May there be success in our mantras for the two-legged and four-legged. May there be auspiciousness for all.

original: bhavaṃ tu sarvesatvāḥ sukhinaḥ santu sarve vidhipūrṇāsantu //
analyzed: bhavam tu sarve satvāḥ sukhinaḥ santu sarve vidhi pūrṇāḥ asantu
translated: May all beings be happy and may all desires be fulfilled.

original: yajamānasya śrī śrī śrīsveṣṭadevatā prītipūrvaka śrī śrī śrīsiddhilakṣmī
analyzed: yajamānasya śrī śrī śrī sva iṣṭadevatā prīti pūrvaka śrī śrī śrī siddhi lakṣmī
translated: For the satisfaction of the most desired deity of the patron, for the establishment of the grace of the accomplished goddess of wealth,

analyzed: devyā prāsada pratiṣṭhā tad upari suvarṇa kalaśa dhvaja ārohana
translated: for the purpose of the sacrificial fire offering with the hoisting of the golden flag on the pot on top of it,

original: yajñanimityarthe na yathā śāstrokta phaladāyino bhavantu //
analyzed: yajña nimiti arthe na yathā phala dāyinaḥ bhavantu
translated: may they be the bestowers of the fruits as stated in the scriptures.

analyzed: calasiṃdūram astu
translated: May the unmoving vermilion be for the patrons.

analyzed: santāna vṛddhiḥ astu yajamānasya sa gaṇa parivārāṇām āyuḥ ārogyam aiśvarya
translated: May there be increase in progeny for the patron along with his retinue, longevity, health,

analyzed: jana dhana lakṣmī santati santāna vṛddhiḥ astu
translated: prosperity, wealth, and increase in the continuity of progeny.

analyzed: yadi ācāryasya viśeṣataḥ  mantra mudrā vihīnaḥ ca sa aṅga paṭhana doṣataḥ
translated: If there is any fault in the sacrifice, especially of the preceptor,🔽due to the absence of mantras and mudras, and the fault of reciting with the limbs,

analyzed: mantra akṣara ādi hīna tvāt da varga ādi viśeṣataḥ
translated: due to the deficiency of mantra syllables, etc., especially of the avarga (consonant group),

analyzed: śuci śīla ādi bhaṅgena yājan paṭhana karmasu
translated: due to the violation of purity, conduct, etc., in the sacrificial and recitation rituals,

analyzed: veda śāstra ādi aśuddhena kriyā hīne na dehinām
translated: due to the impurity of the Vedas, scriptures, etc., and the lack of rites for embodied beings,

analyzed: kṣantum arhasi tat sarvam kurvantu śiva maṅgalam
translated: you should forgive all that and make it auspicious and propitious.

analyzed: santaḥ santa nirantaram su kṛtinaḥ vidhvasta pāpa udayāḥ rājānaḥ pratipālayanti
translated: The virtuous, the continuous performers of good deeds, with their sins destroyed, the kings protect

analyzed: vasudhā dharma sthitā sarvadā
translated: And always abide by the dharma of the earth.

analyzed: kāla santati varṣinaḥ jala mucaḥ santu prajāḥ moditāḥ modantām
translated: May the clouds that shower rain in due season be pleased, and may the people rejoice.

original: dhanavṛddhivāndhava suhaṅgoṣṭhī pramodā sadā //🔽svastiprajābhyaḥ pratipālayatvaṃ nyāyena mārgeṇamahīm mahīśīgo
analyzed: svasti prajābhyaḥ pratipālayatvam nyāyena mārgeṇa mahīm mahīśīgo
translated: May there always be the joy of the assembly of friends and relatives with increasing wealth.🔽May the lord of the earth protect the earth with justice, and may there be well-being for the people.

analyzed: vrāhmaṇebhyaḥ śubha mastu nityam lokāḥ samastāḥ sukhinaḥ bhavantu
translated: May all the worlds be happy, and may there always be auspiciousness for the Brahmins.

analyzed: tu parjanyaḥ pṛthivīśasya śālinī
translated: May the clouds rain in season, and may the earth be fertile.

analyzed: deśaḥ yam kṣobha rahitaḥ vrāhmaṇāḥ santu nirbhayāḥ
translated: May this country be free from disturbances, and may the Brahmins be fearless.

original: ajñānājñānatovā kṛtamakṛtakṛtaṃ yat kṛtaṃ cāti ṛktaṃ /
analyzed: ajñāna ajñānataḥ vā kṛtam akṛta kṛtam yat kṛtam ca ati ṛktam
translated: Whatever has been done out of ignorance or unintentionally, whatever has been done excessively or improperly,

original: mutrāpūjā vidhānaṃ kramayajanavidho stotramajñe na yajñe //
analyzed: mutra apūjā vidhānam krama yajana vidho stotram ajñe na yajñe
translated: The worship of the ancestors, the performance of the sacrificial rites, the hymns in the ignorant sacrifices,

analyzed: yajñe yāga iṣu doṣāḥ haviḥ apinahatim sarva loka eka nātham
translated: The faults in the sacrifices and offerings, the oblations, the destroyer of all, the sole lord of the world,

analyzed: sarvaḥ saṃpūrṇam eva jvalana hutavahaḥ prāñjaliḥ su prasannaḥ
translated: The entire blazing fire, with palms joined, is very pleased.

original: doṣena rājñena ca bhaktibhāvā cāpalyadoṣemunayaḥ prabhāvāḥ /
analyzed: doṣena rājñena ca bhakti bhāvāḥ cāpalya doṣe munayaḥ
translated: The faults of the king, the devotion of the people, the faults of rashness, the powerful sages,

analyzed: nūna adhikam mantra kṛpā adhvareṇa kṣamasva devāḥ mama doṣa hantā
translated: The excess of the mantra, the sacrificial rite, forgive me, O God, the destroyer of my faults.

analyzed: tvam gatiḥ sarva bhūtānām saṃsthiti anta carācare
translated: You are the refuge of all beings, in the beginning, middle, and end of the moving and unmoving world.

analyzed: parameśvarī
translated: As the inner controller of beings, you are the supreme seer.

analyzed: karmaṇā a manasā a vācā tatas nyāya ādi ca kramāt
translated: Then, in order, the rites, mind, speech, and justice, etc.,

analyzed: akṛtam tu tatra
translated: If not performed, deficient in words, there the fire-seat is to be worshipped.

analyzed: mantra hīnam kriyā hīnam bhakti hīnam tathā eva ca
translated: Deficient in mantras, deficient in rituals, deficient in devotion,

analyzed: japa homa arcana hīnam kṣamyatām parameśvarī
translated: Deficient in japa, homa, and worship, may the Supreme Goddess forgive.

analyzed: pāpa ūham pāpa karmāṇām pāpa ātma a pāpa saṃbhava
translated: I am a sinner, the worst of sinners, sinful by nature, born of sin.

analyzed: trāhi imām devadeveśi sarva pāpa haraḥ haraḥ
translated: Protect me, O Goddess of the Lord of Gods, the remover of all sins.

analyzed: iti āśaṃsāśloka samāpta
translated: Thus ends the benedictory verse.

original: khphre hrī śrī sakaladuritā riṣṭakleśadalani svatantraśaktidhāmne kavacāya🔽hūṃ //
analyzed: khphre hrī śrī sakala duritā riṣṭa kleśa dalani svatantra śakti dhāmne kavacāya  hūm
translated: Kshreem Hreem Shrim, to the one who destroys all calamities, afflictions, and distress, to the abode of independent power, to the armor, Hraum.

analyzed: vācana jalena abhiśeṣe ūkāram vāyu vījam ityādi  candana ādi
translated: The syllable U is the seed of air, etc.🔽Sandelwood, etc.🔽Shreekhundachandana etc.

analyzed: śrīkhaṇḍa candanam ityādi
translated: Sthimpurva etc.🔽Veereswari etc.🔽Svaan etc.🔽Nastedeva Devesi etc.

original: vīreśvarītyādi // svāna // nastedeva deveśityādi // āśīrvāda // bhorāvali
analyzed: vīreśvarī ityādi svāna naste deva deveśi ityādi āśīrvāda bho rāvali
translated: Bhobara etc.

analyzed: agni saṃkunalame
translated: Agni Sankunala etc.🔽Shvanah etc.

analyzed: śvanaḥ saṃkhyā kutiḥ
translated: Samkhyakuti etc.

analyzed: ācārya ādīnām puṣpa bhājanam dadet vedī pūjā
translated: One should offer a flower vessel to the teachers and others. Worship of the altar.

analyzed: om vrahmaṇe puṣpam namaḥ
translated: East: Om, to Brahma, I offer flowers.

analyzed: om siddheśvarāya puṣpam namaḥ
translated: South: Om, to Siddheśvara, I offer flowers.

analyzed: paścime om śivāya puṣpam namaḥ
translated: West: Om, to Śiva, I offer flowers.

original: uttara // oṃ māyāyaipuṣpaṃ namaḥ //🔽bhokya // oṃ gurvācāryāyapuṣpaṃ namaḥ //
analyzed: uttara om māyāyai puṣpam namaḥ  om guru ācārya puṣpam namaḥ
translated: North: Om, to Māyā, I offer flowers.🔽Bhukti: Om, to the Guru's Guru, I offer flowers.

analyzed: ācārya om ācāryāya puṣpam namaḥ
translated: Ācārya: Om, to the Ācārya, I offer flowers.

analyzed: pūrṇapātra vīhi ādiṣu ūrayet nyāsa ādi
translated: One should offer the full vessel, rice, etc. Nyāsa, etc.

analyzed: tatas prajāpati devatā māna saṃcintya
translated: Then, having contemplated the deity Prajāpati in the mind,

analyzed: vrāhmā om vrahmaṇe namaḥ
translated: Brahmā: Om, salutations to Brahma.

analyzed: praṇīta om praṇītāya namaḥ vedī
translated: Prāṇīta: Om, salutations to Prāṇīta. Altar:

analyzed: pūrva om vrahmaṇe namaḥ
translated: East: Om, salutations to Brahma.

analyzed: dakṣiṇe om siddheśvarāya namaḥ
translated: South: Om, salutations to Siddheśvara.

analyzed: om śivāya namaḥ
translated: West: Om, salutations to Śiva.

analyzed: uttara om māyāyai namaḥ
translated: North: Om, salutations to Māyā.

analyzed: lokapāla pūjā
translated: Worship of the Lokapālas.

original: lu indrāya namaḥ // ru agnaye namaḥ // mu yamāya namaḥ //🔽kṣu naiṛtyāya namaḥ // vu varuṇāya namaḥ //
analyzed: lu indrāya namaḥ ru agnaye namaḥ mu yamāya namaḥ  kṣu naiṛtyāya namaḥ vu varuṇāya namaḥ
translated: Lu: Salutations to Indra. Ru: Salutations to Agni. Mu: Salutations to Yama.🔽Kṣu: Salutations to Nairṛta. V: Salutations to Varuṇa.

original: yu vāyave namaḥ // su kuverāya namaḥ // hū īśānāya namaḥ //
analyzed: yu vāyave namaḥ su kuverāya namaḥ hū īśānāya namaḥ
translated: Yu: Salutations to Vāyu. Su: Salutations to Kubera. Hū: Salutations to Īśāna.

original: a adhacchandāya namaḥ // oṃ ūrddhacchandāya namaḥ //
analyzed: a adha chandāya namaḥ om ūrddha chandāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the one who is not inclined downwards. Om, salutations to the one who is inclined upwards.

original: pūrvahomeṣu devārcanaṃ // oṃ hrā tripañcāya namaḥ //
analyzed: pūrva homeṣu deva arcanam om hrā tripañcāya namaḥ
translated: In the previous offerings, the worship of the gods. Om, Hram, salutations to the twenty-three.

original: oṃ hrā catuḥ pañcāya namaḥ // oṃ hrā devāgāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrā catuḥ pañcāya namaḥ om hrā devāgāya namaḥ
translated: Om, Hram, salutations to the twenty-four. Om, Hram, salutations to the god of gods.

original: oṃ hrā diśe namaḥ // oṃ hrā vidiśe namaḥ //🔽oṃ hrā svargāya namaḥ // oṃ hrā martyāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrā diśe namaḥ om hrā vidiśe namaḥ  om hrā svargāya namaḥ om hrā martyāya namaḥ
translated: Om, Hram, salutations to the directions. Om, Hram, salutations to the intermediate directions.🔽Om, Hram, salutations to heaven. Om, Hram, salutations to the mortal world.

original: oṃ hrā pātālāya namaḥ // oṃ hrā gauryai namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrā pātālāya namaḥ om hrā gauryai namaḥ
translated: Om, Hram, salutations to the nether world. Om, Hram, salutations to Gauri.

original: oṃ hrā dhātryai namaḥ // oṃ hrā skandāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrā dhātryai namaḥ om hrā skandāya namaḥ
translated: Om, Hram, salutations to Dhatri. Om, Hram, salutations to Skanda.

original: oṃ hrā sūryāya namaḥ // oṃ hrā yogeśvarāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrā sūryāya namaḥ om hrā yogeśvarāya namaḥ
translated: Om, Hram, salutations to Surya. Om, Hram, salutations to the lord of yoga.

original: oṃ hrā mahāyogīśvarāya namaḥ // oṃ hrā triṣṭuvbhyo namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrā mahāyogīśvarāya namaḥ om hrā triṣṭuvbhyaḥ namaḥ
translated: Om, Hram, salutations to the great lord of yoga. Om, Hram, salutations to the Tristubh meters.

original: oṃ hrā devebhyo namaḥ // oṃ hrā ā ṛṣibhyo namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrā devebhyaḥ namaḥ om hrā ā ṛṣibhyaḥ namaḥ
translated: Om, Hram, salutations to the gods. Om, Hram, salutations to the Rishis.

original: oṃ hrā homadevatābhyo namaḥ // oṃ hrā praṇītebhyo namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrā homa devatābhyaḥ namaḥ om hrā praṇītebhyaḥ namaḥ
translated: Om, Hram, salutations to the deities of the oblations. Om, Hram, salutations to the Pranitas.

original: oṃ hrā sarvebhyo namaḥ // oṃ hrā devebhyo namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrā sarvebhyaḥ namaḥ om hrā devebhyaḥ namaḥ
translated: Om, Hram, salutations to all. Om, Hram, salutations to the gods.

analyzed: om hrā tri devebhyaḥ namaḥ
translated: Om, Hram, salutations to the three gods.

analyzed: aṣṭādaśa ṣoḍaśa samidha homa mūlena
translated: The eighteen and sixteen oblations are offered with the root mantra.

original: tato lokapālakalasārcanaṃ // pūrva //🔽oṃ hrā śāntitoraṇāya namaḥ //
analyzed: tatas lokapāla kalasa arcanam  om hrā śānti toraṇāya namaḥ
translated: Then the worship of the water pots of the Lokapalas (Guardians of the Quarters) as before.🔽Om Hraum Namah to the Peace-Gate.

analyzed: om hrā su maṅgala dvārāya namaḥ
translated: Om Hraum Namah to the Well-Auspicious Gate.

analyzed: om lū indrāya namaḥ agniyā
translated: Om Luh Namah to Indra, to Agni.

analyzed: om hrāḥ riddhitoraṇāya namaḥ
translated: Om Hraum Namah to the Prosperity-Gate.

original: oṃ hrā riddhidvārāya namaḥ // oṃ ru agnaye namaḥ // dakṣiṇa //
analyzed: om hrā riddhidvārāya namaḥ om ru agnaye namaḥ dakṣiṇa
translated: Om Hraum Namah to the Prosperity-Gate. Om Ruh Namah to Agni, to the South.

original: oṃ hrā vidyātoraṇāya namaḥ // oṃ hrā suhotradvārāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om   vidyā toraṇāya namaḥ om   suhotra dvārāya namaḥ
translated: Om Hraum Namah to the Knowledge-Gate. Om Hraum Namah to the Well-Heard Gate.

analyzed: om mu yamāya namaḥ naiṛtya
translated: Om Muh Namah to Yama, to the South-West.

original: oṃ hrā kīrtitoraṇāya namaḥ // oṃ hrā kīrtidvārāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrā kīrti toraṇāya namaḥ om hrā kīrti dvārāya namaḥ
translated: Om Hraum Namah to the Fame-Gate. Om Hraum Namah to the Fame-Gate.

original: oṃ hrā ju naiṛyāya namaḥ // paścime //
analyzed: om hrā ju naiṛyāya namaḥ paścime
translated: Om Hraum Namah to Rahu, to the West.

original: oṃ hrā nivṛrtitoraṇāya namaḥ // oṃ hrā kalyāṇadvārāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om   nivṛrti toraṇāya namaḥ om   kalyāṇadvārāya namaḥ
translated: Om Hraum Namah to the Reversal-Gate. Om Hraum Namah to the Auspicious Gate.

analyzed: om vu varuṇāya namaḥ vāyavya
translated: Om Vuh Namah to Varuna, to the North-West.

original: oṃ hrā puṣṭitoraṇāya namaḥ // oṃ hrā puṣṭidvārāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrā puṣṭi toraṇāya namaḥ om hrā puṣṭi dvārāya namaḥ
translated: Om Hraum Namah to the Nourishment-Gate. Om Hraum Namah to the Nourishment-Gate.

original: oṃ hrā yu vāyavya namaḥ // uttara //
analyzed: om hrā yu vāyavya namaḥ uttara
translated: Om Hraum Yuh Namah to Vayu, to the North.

analyzed: om hrā pratiṣṭhā toraṇāya namaḥ
translated: Om Hraum Namah to the Establishment-Gate.

original: oṃ hrā arogyadvārāya namaḥ // oṃ su kuverāya namaḥ // īśāne //
analyzed: om hrāḥ arogya dvārāya namaḥ om su kuverāya namaḥ īśāne
translated: Om Hraum Namah to the Health-Gate. Om Svaha Namah to Kubera, to the North-East.

original: oṃ hrā siddhitoraṇāya namaḥ // oṃ hrā siddhidvārāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrā siddhitoraṇāya namaḥ om hrā siddhidvārāya namaḥ
translated: Om Hram Siddhi Torana (Gateway to Accomplishment), salutations! Om Hram Siddhi Dvara (Accomplishment Door), salutations!

analyzed: om hū īśānāya namaḥ avayā
translated: Om Hram Ishana (Lord of the North-East), salutations! Avaya (Below)!

original: oṃ hrā advārāya namaḥ // oṃ hrā adhatoraṇāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om hrāḥ advārāya namaḥ om hrāḥ adha toraṇāya namaḥ
translated: Om Hram Advara (Lower Door), salutations! Om Hram Adhatorana (Lower Gateway), salutations!

analyzed: om anantāya namaḥ ūrddha
translated: Om Hram Ananta (Infinite), salutations! Urddhva (Above)!

original: oṃ hrā ūrddhatoraṇāya namaḥ // oṃ hrā ūrddhadvārāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om   ūrddha toraṇāya namaḥ om   ūrddha dvārāya namaḥ
translated: Om Hram Urddhatorana (Upper Gateway), salutations! Om Hram Urddhadvara (Upper Door), salutations!

analyzed: om om vrahmaṇe namaḥ śiva śakti
translated: Om Om Brahma (Brahma), salutations! Shiva Shakti (Shiva and Shakti)!

original: oṃ ju saḥ mṛtyuñjayāya amṛtīśvarāya mahālakṣmī śaktisahitāya namaḥ //
analyzed: om ju saḥ mṛtyuñjayāya amṛtīśvarāya mahālakṣmī śakti sahitāya namaḥ
translated: Om Ju Sah to Mrityunjaya (Conqueror of Death), Lord of Amrita (Nectar), accompanied by the Shakti of Great Lakshmi, salutations!

analyzed: thvana
translated: Thvan!

original: gā gaṇapataye namaḥ // guru // gurumūrtaye namaḥ //
analyzed: gāḥ gaṇapataye namaḥ guru guru mūrtaye namaḥ
translated: Ga to Ganapati (Lord of Ganas), salutations! Guru (Preceptor)! To the Form of the Guru, salutations!

analyzed: kṣatra kṣā kṣetrapālāya namaḥ
translated: Kshana! Ksha to Kshetrapala (Guardian of the Sacred Ground), salutations!

analyzed: yoginā yā yoginībhyaḥ namaḥ
translated: Yogina! Ya to Yoginis (Female Practitioners of Yoga), salutations!

original: śrīlakṣmī // śrīmūrtaye namaḥ // hrā lakṣmī mūrtaye namaḥ //

analyzed: astra om hrāḥ astra kalaśāya namaḥ

original: vāstu // oṃ hrā hrī hrū vāstvadhipataye vrahmaṇe namaḥ //
analyzed: vāstu om hrā hrī hrū vāstu adhipataye vrahmaṇe namaḥ
translated: Vastu! Om Hram Hrim Hru to the Lord of the House, Brahma, salutations!🔽Shanta! Om Hram to the Pot of Peace, Svaha!

analyzed: āditya om hrāḥ ādityāya namaḥ

original: nāgadya // oṃ ju saḥ varuṇāya namaḥ // mṛtyuñjaya //🔽oṃ jū saḥ mṛtyuñjayāya namaḥ //🔽yakṣayakṣarī // oṃ yakṣāya namaḥ // oṃ yakṣaṇyai namaḥ //
analyzed: nāgadya om ju saḥ varuṇāya namaḥ mṛtyuñjaya  om jū saḥ mṛtyuñjayāya namaḥ  yakṣayakṣarī om yakṣāya namaḥ om yakṣaṇyai namaḥ
translated: Naga Dya - Om Ju Sah Varuna Namas. Mrityunjaya - Om Ju Sah Mrityunjaya Namas.🔽Yaksha Yakshini - Om Yakshasya Namas. Om Yakshinyae Namas.

original: śrīlakṣmī // oṃ śriyai namaḥ // oṃ lakṣmyai namaḥ //
analyzed: śrī lakṣmī om śriyai namaḥ om lakṣmyai namaḥ
translated: Shri Lakshmi - Om Shrim Hrim Shriye Deviye Namah. Om Shrim Hrim Lakshmiye Deviye Namah.

original: soghamāga // oṃ varuṇāya namaḥ // thaṇḍilanavākyariṇa // kṣetri āvāhana
analyzed: om varuṇāya namaḥ kṣetri āvāhana
translated: Soghamaga - Om Varunaya Namah. Thandil Nava Kyari Na - Kshetri Avahana.

analyzed: ro-0
translated: Mula Na - Om Shrim Hrim Klim Shri Maha Lakshmi Deviye Namah.

analyzed: om śānti toraṇāya svāhā
translated: Om Shanti Toranaya Svaha.

original: oṃ sumaṃgaladvārāya svāhā // oṃ lu indrāya svāhā //
analyzed: om sumaṃgaladvārāya svāhā om lu indrāya svāhā
translated: Om Sumangaladvaraya Svaha. Om Lu Indraya Svaha.

translated: Indra is the lord of the gods, with a thunderbolt in his hand and great strength.

original: oṃ hrā riddhitoraṇāya svāhā // oṃ hrā riddhidvārāya svāhā //
analyzed: om   riddhitoraṇāya svāhā om   riddhidvārāya svāhā
translated: The god of a hundred sacrifices, salutations to that Indra. Agneya - Om Hram Riddhi Toranaya Svaha. Om Hram Riddhi Dwaraya Svaha.

translated: with a spear in his hand and great splendor, salutations to that Vaishvanara. Dakshinaya -

analyzed: om vidyā toraṇāya svāhā om suhotra dvārāya svāhā

original: oṃ hrā kīrtitoraṇāya svāhā // oṃ hrā kīrtidvārāya svāhā //

original: oṃ nivṛrtitoraṇāya svāhā // oṃ kalyāṇadvārāya svāhā //

The god with a noose in hand, the king of the waters, of great strength,

analyzed: śveta varṇā mahā tejaḥ nāga rājam namāmi aham
translated: white in color, of great splendor, I pay homage to the king of the nagas. To Vayu.

original: oṃ hrā puṣṭitoraṇāya svāhā // oṃ hrā puṣṭidvārāya svāhā //

analyzed: om vāyavya svāhā

translated: The one who holds a club and a vessel, the powerful one, the conqueror of the senses, salutations to you. With the Ishana mantra.

analyzed: om anantāya svāhā

analyzed: pannaga adhipatiḥ deva anantaḥ nāma viśrutaḥ
translated: The lord of the serpents, the god known as Ananta,

translated: Always resides in the netherworld. Salutations to you, Narayana. With the upward mantra.

original: oṃ hrā ūrddhatoraṇāya svāhā // oṃ hrā ūrddhadvārāya svāhā //
analyzed: om   ūrddha toraṇāya svāhā om   ūrddha dvārāya svāhā
translated: Om, Hram, salutations to the upper threshold! Om, Hram, salutations to the upper door!

translated: Om Om, salutations to Brahma. The one with four faces, residing on the head,

analyzed: tasmai ca vrahmaṇe namaḥ

analyzed: om saḥ mṛtyuṃjayāya amṛtīśvarāya svāhā

analyzed: sarva pāpa vināśāya sarva śānti namaḥ namaḥ

analyzed: sarva kāryeṣu kartavyam sarva vighna nivāraṇam

analyzed: guru om guru mūrtaye svāhā

analyzed: kṣatrayā kṣā kṣatrapālāya svāhā

analyzed: yoginī yoginībhyaḥ svāhā

analyzed: trailokya vyāpiṇīm devīm karti kāpāla dhāriṇī

analyzed: vighna marda karīm devī yoginī tvām namāmi aham  śrī lakṣmī śrī mūrtaye svāhā
